Medium to large, semidouble; distinctive crepe on petals; wide petals similar to 'Drama Girl'; stamens are less regular than the parent 'Katie'; overall size is smaller than 'Katie' even when treated. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. E-M. (Sport of Japonica 'Katie'). (U.S. 2016 - Thomas Sellers, Bolivia, NC).

name: Catherine Cathcart

name: Catherine Hall

name: Catherine Jane
description: White. Miniature, formal double. Slow, upright growth. E-M. (N.Z. 1984 - J. Mortinson, Hamilton).

name: Catherine McCOWN

name: Catherine Stimson
description: Crimson. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (Aus. 1964 - W. A. Stimson, Cheltenham).

name: Cathy Becher

Large to Very Large, anemone to loose peony form. Average, upright, medium density growth. M. (U.S. 2021 - Gordy).

name: Cathy Jones

name: Cavalier

name: Cavalier's Lady

name: Cay Mckenzie
description: Light clear Pink. Large, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1970 - L. Baggs, Macon, GA).

name: Cdr Donald Oyler
description: Light Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, rose form double. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Lady Laura'). (U.S. 2019 - Jim Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: Cecil Beard
description: Red with high amount of White. Large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, dense, upright growth. M-L. (Japonica 'Ville de Nantes' x Japonica 'Granada'). (U.S. 1994 - Jernigan).

name: Cecil Rogers
description: Pink. Large, formal double of tiered form. (U.S. 1965 - Habel).

name: Cecile

Medium, formal double with ruffled petals. (Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' seedling). (Ralph S. Peer Sasanqua seedling Award of American Camellia Society - First Award Season-1959).

name: Celebration

name: Celebrity

name: Celestine

name: Centennial

name: Chalice

name: Challenger
description: Light Pink. Medium, peony form. (U.S. 1944 - Magnolia).

name: Chameleon

name: Champagne Music

(U.S. 1996 - Hall). *CHANG'S TEMPLE - Reticulata - ('Zhangjia Cha' - Chinese Name). China Rose. Very large, semidouble; large, open center with some petaloids, up to 20 petals in 4 or 5 rows; petals are deeply notched, some with multiple markings. Vigorous, compact growth with very large leaves. M-L. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to N.Z. 1964 - Durrant).

name: Chandler's Victory

description: Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1975 - Haynie).

name: Charles Kahn

description: Dark Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1954 - Turner).

name: Chatham

name: Chee-Ree

EGAO (SMILING FACE) - Formerly Vernalis - Deep Pink, Deeper Pink in the lower half of the petals with Yellow Stamens and Pale Yellow filaments. Medium to large, semidouble. Vigorous upright, somewhat spreading growth. M. (Not to be confused with Japonica 'Egao' - a separate variety). (Japan to U.S. 1977 - Nuccio's). EGAO CORKSCREW - Formerly Vernalis - Pink. Small to medium, semidouble to loose peony form with ruffled petals. Average, spreading growth; distinctive zig-zag growth habit. M. (Sport of Sasanqua 'Egao'). (Previously considered to be a non-retic hybrid). (U.S. 2000 - Nuccio's). EGAO FORMAL PINK - Formerly Vernalis - Bright Pink. Medium, formal double with some blooms a spiral. description: Cream White. Large, peony form with notched petals. Vigorous, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Wilkinson).

name: Egao
description: Light Pink. Large, single with circular White stamens. (Not to be confused with Sasanqua 'Egao' - a separate variety). See Higo.

name: Eighteen Scholars
description: White background sporting eighteen different flowers in combinations of White, Pink and Red. Medium, formal double. (For another form of this cultivar see 'Chung Cho Yang'). (U.S. [Peer] from Formosa/Taiwan 1955).

name: Eighteen Year-Old Maiden
description: ('Se Ba Bian' - Chinese Name'; '18 Years Young Lady'). White with small patches of Pink to Red on the outer petals. Large, loose peony form. (Reticulata hybrid 'Wang WW#8' × Reticulata hybrid 'Ruta Hagmann'). (U.S. 2012 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Eileen Crocker Hart
description: Shades of Strawberry and Watermelon Red with Gold anthers and Pink filaments. Large, semidouble form with incurved petals; has rabbit ears that stand up nicely. Average, upright, open growth. E-M. (U.S. 2022 - Emma Jean Crocker, Thomasville, GA).

name: Eileen Sebire
description: Deep Cyclamen Pink. Very large, peony form. Vigorous, upright, compact growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Cornelian' seedling). (Aus. 1987 - Sebire).

name: Eileen Weidman
description: Medium Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Large, anemone to full peony form. Average, upright, dense growth. M. (U.S. 2019 - Gordy).

name: Eileen's Smile
description: White with some Deep Pink freckles with Gold anthers and Creamy Yellow filaments. Large, semidouble form. Average, upright, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Reticulata hybrid 'Mouchang'). (U.S. 2021 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: El Diablo Rojo
description: French Raspberry. Large, loose peony to semidouble form with waxy, thin, crepe textured, irregular petals. Average, upright growth. E-L. (Japonica 'Don-Mac' x Japonica 'Guilio Nuccio'). (U.S. 2016 - Fred and Sandra Jones, Moultrie, GA).

name: El Dorado
description: Light Pink. Large, full peony form. Average, spreading growth. M. (Pitardii x Japonica 'Tiffany'). (U.S. 1967 - Asper).

name: El Greco
description: Currant Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' seedling). (Aus. 1971 - Tuckfield).

name: El Matador
description: Dark Red. Large, semidouble with upright petals. Compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1962 - Camelliana).

name: El Rojo
description: Bright Deep Red. Medium, rose form double to formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1972 - Wilson).

name: Elaine
description: Medium Pink with bright Yellow anthers and White filaments. Very large, semidouble; the petals are fluted. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Curtain Call' × Reticulata hybrid 'Pleasant Memories'). (U.S. 2013 - James and Elaine Smelley).

name: Elaine Lee
description: White. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E-M. Flower and plant cold hardy to - 10°F. (U.S. 1999 - Ackerman).

name: Elaine Smelley
description: Light Pink edged White. Medium, formal double. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1978 - Belle Fontaine Nsy., Theodore, AL).

name: Elaine's Betty
description: Pale Peach Pink center with occasional Rose Red stripes and spots shading to Deeper Pink at petal edges. Medium, peony form to rose form double with highly ruffled petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth; foliage is creped and serrated. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Betty Sheffield). (U.S. 1996 - J. and E. Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: Elaine's Betty Blush
description: Deep Pink in the center, shading to Peachy Pink, with Blush Pink edges with Gold anthers and Pale Yellow filaments. Medium to large, loose peony to rose form double. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth; bloom is much more robust than most 'Elaine's Betty' sports. M. (Color sport of Japonica 'Elaine's Betty'). (U.S. 2018 - Gordon Rabalais, Arnaudville, LA).

name: Elaine's Betty Pink
description: Medium Pink center shading to Deeper Pink at petal edges. Medium, peony form to rose form double with highly ruffled petals. Vigorous, open upright growth; foliage is creped and serrated. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Elaine's Betty'). (U.S. 2010 - James and Elaine Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: Elaine's Betty Red
description: Deep Rose to Red center shading to Deeper Red at petal edges. Medium, peony form to rose form double with highly ruffled petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth; foliage is creped and serrated. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Elaine's Betty'). (U.S. 2010 - James and Elaine Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: Elaine's Betty White

Medium, loose peony to rose form double; the tips of the petals are Green at the bud stage which open very ruffled and fimbriated. Average, upright, spreading growth. M. (Color and form sport of Japonica 'Elaine's Betty'). (U.S. 2018 - Gordon Rabalais, Arnaudville, LA).

name: Elbert Botts
description: Pink. Medium, star shaped rose form double. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1995 - W. Wilson, Augusta, GA).

name: Eleanor Finley
description: Red at center of flower, edge of petals Violet shading into Pink. Medium to large, semidouble form. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 2005 - H. Finley Jones, Lake Charles, LA).

name: Eleanor Franchetti
description: White striped Rose Pink. Medium, full peony form. (Italy 1881 - Franchetti).

name: Eleanor Franchetti Pink
description: Solid Pink form of 'Eleanor Franchetti.

name: Eleanor Grant
description: Delicate Rose. Large, semidouble to loose peony form with large, slightly ruffled and waved petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1958 - Mrs. A. Grant, Dothan, AL).

name: Eleanor Grant Variegated
description: Delicate Rose blotched White variation of 'Eleanor Grant'.

name: Eleanor Greenway
description: Blush streaked and flecked Deep Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - Mrs. C. H. Maryott, Augusta, GA).

name: Eleanor Greenway Pink
description: Light Pink with Golden anthers and White filaments. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Eleanor Greenway'). (U.S. 2019 - Paul Greenway, Martinez, GA).

name: Eleanor Hagood
description: Pale Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. L. Cold hardy. (For a variation of this cultivar see Japonica 'Carolyn Luce'). (U.S. early 1900's - Magnolia).

name: Eleanor Hagood Variegated
description: Pale Pink and White variation of 'Eleanor Hagood'.

name: Eleanor Holtzman
description: White washed and shaded Orchid Pink. Medium, semidouble with Higo-like stamens. Vigorous, upright growth. E- L. (U.S. 1981 - J. Holtzman, Crow's Landing, CA).

name: Eleanor K

name: Eleanor Martin

name: Eleanor Martin Supreme

name: Eleanor McCOWN
description: White streaked Red and Pink. Medium, semidouble to anemone form. Vigorous, loose, upright growth. M. (For a variation of this cultivar see Japonica 'Catherine McCown'). (U.S. 1942 - Shepp).

name: Eleanor McCRADY
description: Bright Pink. Very large, semidouble with loose petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. Early 1900's - Magnolia).

name: Eleanor McCRADY Variegated

name: Eleanor McDOWELL
description: Rose Pink. Large, semidouble of pine cone form. Compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1950 - Tea Gardens).

name: Eleanor Mertson
description: Dark Red. Large, semidouble with flared stamens. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1982 - Magnolia).

name: Eleanor Nichols
description: Pinkish White spotted and lined Pink. Small, formal double. Vigorous growth. L. (U.S. 1953 - Dr. W. E. Nichols, Pasadena, CA).

name: Eleanor Of Fairoaks
description: ('Vedrine Variegated'). Deep Ruby Red marbled White. (Variegated variation of Japonica 'Vedrine'). (U.S. [LA]. From Italy 1906).

name: Eleanor Waltz
description: White. Medium, formal double with swirled notched petals. Average, open, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1980 - E. E. Waltz, Perry Hall, MD).

name: Eleanor Wilds
description: Light Pink with petals faintly margined palest Pink. Medium, semidouble. Slow, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1940 - Dr. R. H. Wilds, Aiken, SC).

name: Elegans (Chandler)

name: Elegans (Chandler) Variegated

name: Elegans Champagne
description: White with Cream center petaloids with Pink occasionally at base of petals. Large to very large, anemone form. (Sport of Japonica 'Elegans Splendor'). (U.S. 1975 - Nuccio's).

name: Elegans Improved
description: Rose Pink with center petaloids often spotted White. Large to very large, anemone form. Slow, spreading growth. E-M. (Sport of Japonica 'Elegans' with larger leaves and flowers). (U.S. 2010).

name: Elegans Miniata

name: Elegans Splendor

name: Elegans Supreme

name: Elegant Beauty
description: Deep Rose. Large, anemone form. Open, upright growth. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica 'Elegans [Chandler]'). (N.Z. 1962 - Jury).

name: Elena Lorenzo
description: Rose Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1967 - Dr. M. B. Wine, Thomasville, GA).

name: Elena Nobile
description: ('Napa Red'). Flame Red. Medium, rose form double. Slow, upright growth. L. (Italy 1881 - Franchetti).

name: Elfin
description: Pink. Small, formal double. ELFIN ROSE - Formerly Hiemalis - Rose Pink. Small, rose form double.

name: Elfin Charm
description: Oriental Red. Miniature, formal double. Average, compact, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1960 - Short).

name: Elisabeth
description: ('Montironi'; 'Trois Marie'; 'Elizabeth'; 'Teutonia White'; 'Victoria and Albert'). White, sometimes striped Light Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. I. (For another form of this cultivar, see Japonica 'Milady'). (Belgium [Vershaffelt] from Italy 1851).

name: Elisabeth Holmes, Junior
description: Pale Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1958 - Holmes).

name: Elisabeth Sizemore
description: White. Large, round semidouble with large, smooth, thick petals. Average, spreading, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1969 - D. English, Jr., Dawson, GA).

name: Elise Aldrich
description: White. Large, formal double with spiral, cupped petals. Average, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 1988 - J. Aldrich, Brooklet, GA).

name: Elise Winter
description: Rose Pink fading at center. Large, rose form double. Vigorous, upright, open growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/ Japonica hybrid). (U.S. 1980 - Pursel).

name: Eliska-Deon
description: Dark Red. Large, peony form. E-M. (U.S. 1957 - Mrs. V. D. Myers, McComb, MS).

name: Elizabeth Acree

name: Elizabeth Ann Linhuber

name: Elizabeth Arden

name: Elizabeth Astles

name: Elizabeth B. Hunt
description: Pink with Golden anthers and White filaments. Medium to large, semidouble to rose form double. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. E-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' x Reticulata hybrid 'Delta Dawn'). (U.S. 2007 - Hulyn Smith).

name: Elizabeth Bay
description: Rose mottled White. Medium, peony form. M. (Aus. 1962 - Elizabeth Bay, Sydney).

name: Elizabeth Burch
description: Medium Pink. Large, formal double form. Average, upright, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Beatrix Hoyt'). (U.S. 2021 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Elizabeth Carroll
description: White. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (U.S. 1958 - Casadaban Nsy., Abita Springs, LA).

name: Elizabeth Cooper
description: White. Medium, formal double with swirled petals. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1977 - Tammia).

name: Elizabeth Councilman
description: Brilliant Red. Large, semidouble with fluted petals. Average, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 1961 - Councilman).

name: Elizabeth Dell
description: White with a few Red dashes. Large, semidouble. Average, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1964 - Julington).

name: Elizabeth Dowd
description: White with small dashes of Pink on some petals. Large, rose form double. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1960- Ashby).

name: Elizabeth Dowd Mystique

Medium, semidouble to rose form double. Average, upright, open growth; the leaves are very uniquely colored medium Green with random markings of soft Lime Green, resembling markings done by an artist's brush; at times there are three shades of Green on some leaves. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'Elizabeth Dowd Silver'). (U.S. 2013 - James and Elaine Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: Elizabeth Dowd Rose
description: Solid Rose Pink. (Sport of Japonica 'Elizabeth Dowd'). (U.S. 1975 - Wilson).

name: Elizabeth Dowd Silver
description: Blush Pink bordered White. Large, rose form double. (Sport of Japonica 'Elizabeth Dowd'). (U.S. 1973 - Wilson).

name: Elizabeth Dowd Stripe

name: Elizabeth Fleming
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1944 - Boardman).

name: Elizabeth Gibbs
description: Rose Red. Medium, full peony form. Vigorous, open growth. E. (U.S. 1955 - Mrs. E. P. Seay, Charleston, SC).

name: Elizabeth Glunt
description: Rose Pink variegated White with Rose Pink stripes. Miniature, formal double with incurved petals. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1997 - C. Elliott, Swainsboro, GA).

name: Elizabeth Gorton

name: Elizabeth Harris
description: Burgundy Red with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, anemone to full peony form. Average, upright, dense growth. E-M. (First Lady of Georgia Series). (U.S. 2018 - Gordy).

name: Elizabeth Hawkins
description: Bright Red. Small, anemone form. (England: 1972 - Carlyon).

name: Elizabeth Hicklin
description: Soft Pink shading to Lighter Pink at ruffled edge of petals. Large, rose form double with Light stamens and a few crinkled petaloids. Compact, upright growth. (U.S. 1961 - Mrs. E W Hicklin, Columbia, SC).

name: Elizabeth Hill

name: Elizabeth Holmes
description: Light Pink with Deeper Pink markings. Medium, semidouble of cupped form opening with bud center. Compact growth. L. (U.S. 1956 - Magnolia).

name: Elizabeth Hyatt Haynie
description: Clear bright Rose with Blue undertones. Large, semidouble with upright, folded petals. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1967 - Haynie).

name: Elizabeth Johnston
description: See 'Lady Loch'.

name: Elizabeth Johnstone
description: Bright Rose. Large, single. (Reticulata hybrid 'Wild Form' seedling). (England 1957).

name: Elizabeth Le Bey
description: Light Rose Pink. Large, loose to full peony form with large petals and large, erect petaloids. Vigorous, pendulous growth. E-L. (U.S. 1948 - Wilkinson).

name: Elizabeth Le Bey Blush
description: Light Pink margined White. (Sport of Japonica 'Elizabeth Le Bey'). (U.S. 1966 - Mrs. W M Harrison, Pensacola, FL).

name: Elizabeth Le Bey Variegated

name: Elizabeth M. Tarver
description: Creamy White. Large, semidouble to loose peony form with long, Blond stamens and ruffled and twisted • petaloids. Vigorous, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1960 - Dr. J. B. Tarver, San Marino, CA).

name: Elizabeth Nedra Mathis
description: Dark Red with Yellow anthers and Red filaments. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. M. (U.S. 2009 - Homeyer).

name: Elizabeth Payne
description: Red marbled White. Large, anemone form to loose peony form. M. (Portugal 1960 - Da Silva).

name: Elizabeth Rothschild
description: Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble. M-L. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (England 1950 - Hanger).

name: Elizabeth Stanton

name: Elizabeth Tarrant
description: Rose Pink. Very large, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1998 - Rupert E. Drews, Charleston, SC).

name: Elizabeth Weaver
description: Coral Pink. Medium to large, formal double. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1975 - Homeyer).

name: Elizabeth Weems
description: Rose Pink. Large, semidouble. Average growth. E-M. (U.S. 1967 - C. A. Owens, Aiken, SC).

name: Ella Drayton (Magnolia Gardens)
description: Pink fading to lighter Pink in center. Small, formal double. (Europe to U.S. [Magnolia] 1840's).

name: Ella Gamlin
description: Deep Pink. Medium, single with flaring stamens. Average, open growth. E-M. (Saluenensis x Japonica ). (N.Z. 1972 - B. G. Rayner, Stratford).

name: Ella Gayle Hamlin
description: Vivid Pink. Very large, peony form. Average, upright, dense, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 1989 - Tammia).

description: White shaded Orchid Pink. Medium, formal double to rose form double. (U.S. 1968 - Habel).

description: Light Pink with Deeper Pink margin. Large, semidouble. Average, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1989 - Elizabeth R. Scott, Aiken, SC).

name: Ella Wood Pink
description: Pink. (Sport of Japonica 'Ella Wood').

name: Ellamine
description: Pink. Large, single. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (Aus. 1955 - Waterhouse).

name: Elle B
description: Burgundy with Yellow anthers and Burgundy filaments. Small, rose form double. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 2019 - J. Allen Bourland, Dothan, AL).

name: Ellen Daniel
description: Blush Pink with Red stripes. Miniature to small, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1971 - Tammia).

name: Ellen Daniel Red
description: Bright Red. Miniature to small, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (Color sport of Japonica 'Ellen Daniel). (U.S. 1980's).

name: Ellen Daniel Red Variegated
description: Bright Red with vivid White mottling. Miniature to small, formal double to peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (Virus variegated form of Japonica 'Ellen Daniel Red'). (U.S. 1980's).

name: Ellen Doubleday
description: Flesh Pink marked deep Pink. Medium, formal double to rose form double. Vigorous, slender growth. M. (U.S. 1946 - Magnolia).

name: Ellen Goff
description: Bright Pink. Large, semidouble to peony form of thick form with upright petals. Average, open growth. M. (U.S. 1960 - M. Goff, West Columbia, SC).

description: Deep Pink. Medium, anemone form to full peony form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1974 - C. C. Carpender, Wilmington, NC).

name: Elsaki
description: Rose Pink. Large, peony form. L. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (England 1957).

name: Elsie Hughes
description: Pink. Very large, formal double to rose form double. Average, spreading growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robé' x Reticulata hybrid 'Cameron Cooper'). (U.S. 1985 - Pursel).

name: Elsie May
description: Salmon Pink. Very large, semidouble to anemone form. Upright, open growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Cornelian' x Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha'). (Aus. 1984 - Pierson).

name: Elsie Ruth Marshall
description: Light Pink to Light Purplish Pink. Large, rose form double to loose peony form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1965 - Marshall).

name: Elspeth Berg
description: Red. Large, semidouble with some upright petals. Average, upright, open growth. E-M. (Saluenensis x Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (N.Z. 1975 - Mrs. I. Berg, Whakatane).

name: Elvige
description: Blush to White. Large, rose form double. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1976 - Belle Fontaine Nsy., Theodore, AL).

name: Em Hyer
description: Dark Red with Purplish cast at petal edges. Large, rose form double. Vigorous, open growth. M. (U.S. 1954 - Turner).

name: Emerson Waltz
description: Pale Peach Pink. Large, semidouble with upright, notched petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1987 - Ackerman).

name: Emil's Jane
description: Rose Red. Miniature, anemone form. Vigorous, dense, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1996 - E. Carroll, Albuquerque, NM).

description: Light Pink. Large, semidouble. Average, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1954 - Miss E. Raggio, Scott, LA).

description: See 'Hishi-Karaito'.

description: Red. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (Pitardii x Reticulata). (N.Z. 1973 - Mrs. A. B. Durrant, Rotorua).

name: Emily Mathis
description: White with Cream center. Large, semidouble with notched, twisted, upright petals and bunched stamens. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1963 - Dr. W. F. Mathis, Moultrie, GA).

name: Emily Wilson

description: Red. (Sport of Japonica 'Fandango'). (U.S. 1971 - McCaskill).

name: Fannie Loughridge
description: Red. Large, anemone form to loose peony form with upright center petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - Mrs. F. Loughridge, Pascagoula, MS).

name: Fannie Loughridge Variegated
description: Red blotched White variation of 'Fannie Loughridge'.

name: Fannie Louise Maphis
description: Pink with Golden anthers and White filaments. Very large, semidouble to rose form double. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' x Reticulata hybrid 'Delta Dawn'). (U.S. 1997 - Hulyn Smith).

name: Fannie Mae
description: Dark Red. Medium to large, formal double. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Royal Velvet'). (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Fanny Davenport
description: See 'Gigantea'.

name: Fantasia
description: Red mottled White form of 'Jarvis Red'. Small, semidouble. (U.S. 1949 - Armstrong).

name: Fantastic
description: Pink. Large, single. Average, spreading growth. E-L. (Saluenensis × Japonica 'Pukekura'). (N.Z. 1981 - Jury).

name: Fantasy (California)
description: White or Shell Pink or Pink and White. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1935 - McCaskill).

name: Farfalla
description: Pink. Medium, single. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica ). (Aus. 1962 - Waterhouse).

name: Fashion Note
description: Cream with Rose Pink border. Medium, single with occasional upright petals.

name: Fashion Plate
description: White edged Pink to Dark Pink. Medium, single.

name: Fashionata
description: Apricot Pink. Large, semidouble with curled and crepe outer petals and occasional cluster of petaloids. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (Reported to be sport of Japonica 'Faith'). (U.S. 1964 - F. D. Everette, Mobile, AL).

name: Father L.
description: Bright Cerise Pink. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, spreading growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid). (U.S. 1973 - Kramer).

name: Fawn
description: Creamy Pink shaded Deeper Pink. Miniature, semidouble with twisted petals in center. Vigorous, bushy, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1973 - McCaskill).

name: Fay Charles
description: Light Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble with broad petals.

name: Faye Wheeler
description: Light Pink. Medium, semidouble to loose peony form with long, irregular petals and upright center petals. Vigorous, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1956 - Wheeler).

name: Fbi
description: Light Lavender. Miniature, anemone form. (Sport of Hybrid 'Bonnie Marie').

name: Feasti
description: ('Blushing Bride'). White dashed Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, angular, upright growth. M. ('Variations of this cultivar include 'Sharon Raye Pearson'; 'Elizabeth Stanton'). (U.S. 1841 - S. Feast, Baltimore, MD).

name: Feathered Edge
description: White to Blush gradually darkening toward the edge and having feathered streaks radiating toward the center. Medium, semidouble to loose peony. Compact, rounded growth. (U.S. 2005 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Feathers Fragrant
description: White blushed with Pink on outer petals with Gold anthers and White filaments. Miniature, single form. Average, spreading, medium density growth. E-M. Cold Hardy. Fragrant. (C. cuspidata x C. fraterna). (U.S. 2020 - Feathers).

name: Feathery Touch
description: White with faint Blush at center and on back of petals and highly ruffled petals. Medium, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica 'Frizzle White'). (U.S. 1971 - C. R. Butler, Mobile, AL).

name: Federation
description: Deep Pink at edge of petals, shading to White at base of petals. Large, loose peony form. Average, bushy, upright growth. M. (Aus. 2003 - Camellias Victoria Inc., Mount Waverley, Vic.).

name: Felice Harris
description: Pale Orchid Pink. Large, semidouble with fluted petals. Vigorous, upright, compact growth. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (U.S. 1960 - Asper).

name: Felice Harris Variegated
description: Pale Orchid Pink variegated form of 'Felice Harris'. (U.S. 1963 - Mark S. Cannon, Dothan, AL).

name: Fenejiao
description: See 'Pretty Pink'. "FENGSHAN CAMELLIA - Reticulata - ('Fengshan Cha' - Chinese Name). Carmine. Large to very large, rose form double with wavy petals. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1980 - U. C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

name: Fengshan Cha
description: See 'Fengshan Camellia'.

name: Fenhudie
description: See 'Butterfly Pink'.

name: Fensan Xueshi (Pink Three Scholars)
description: Pink with occasional Red tick. Medium, formal double, star-shaped with incurved petal edges. Average, upright, very dense growth. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'Baisan Xueshi"'). (China 1981 - Wang and Yu).

name: Fenyu (Shanghai)
description: White center with Pink edge with Yellow anthers and Light Yellow filaments. Small to medium, semidouble. Average, dense growth. E. (Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' × Sasanqua 'Shinonome'). (China 2009 - Jian Guo Fei, Yong-hong Hu and Ya-li Zhang, Shanghai Botanical Garden of Shanghai, China).

name: Fernandina
description: Velvety Red. Medium, loose peony form. Slow, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1943 - Gerbing).

name: Ferol Ilene
description: White. Medium, formal double. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1971 - Tammia).

name: Ferol Zerkowsky
description: Blush Pink. Large to very large, semidouble to peony form. Average, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1987 - Tammia).

name: Ferris Wheel

Large to very large, semidouble to loose peony with an occasional anemone flower. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 2016 - Nuccio's).

name: Festival
description: Blush Pink. Medium to large, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1970 - Kramer).

name: Festival Of Lights
description: Pale Pink with some petals having Deep Pink stripes. Miniature, single. Average, columnar growth. M-L. (Pitardii seedling). (N.Z. 2001 - Haydon).

name: Fiery Furnace
description: Fire Red. Medium to large, full peony form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1960 - Short).

name: Fiesta
description: Light Coral Red. Large, semidouble to peony form. Bushy, pendulous growth. M-L. (U.S. 1956 - Marshall).

name: Fiesta Grande
description: Light Lavender Pink. Medium, semidouble to loose peony form. Vigorous, upright, compact growth. E-L. (Japonica x Reticulata hybrid 'Flower Girl'). (U.S. 1986 - Piet and Gaeta).

name: Fiesta Grande Variegated
description: Light Lavender Pink and White variation of 'Fiesta Grande'. (U.S. 1990 - Piet and Gaeta).

name: Fiesta Variegated
description: Light Coral Red blotched White variation of 'Fiesta'.

name: Fifth Avenue
description: White. Medium to large, full peony form. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1967 - Shackelford).

name: Fifty First Battalion
description: Light Crimson Red. Medium to large, semidouble. Vigorous, dense, upright growth. E-L. (Aus. 1991 - K. Abbott, Rossmoyne, W. Aus.).

name: Fight On
description: Dark Red with Red stamens tipped with Golden anthers. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright, compact growth. L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Flower Girl' × Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (U.S. 1982 - Piet and Gaeta).

name: Filo Junior
description: Light Pink. Medium, full peony form. Open, pendulous growth. M. (U.S. 1954 - Turner).

name: Filoli Red
description: Brilliant Red. Very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata seedling). (U.S. 1996 - Hall).

name: Fimbriata
description: ('Alba Fimbriata'; 'Fimbriata Alba'). White fringed petals. Medium, formal double. (Sport of Japonica 'Alba Plena'). (China to England [Chandler] 1816).

name: Fimbriata Alba
description: See 'Fimbriata'.

name: Fimbriata Superba
description: See 'Fred Sander'.

name: Fimbriata Superba Variegated
description: See 'Fred Sander Variegated'.

name: Fimbriated Fragrance
description: Tomato Red. Medium, rose form double with no obvious petaloids and stamens with bright Yellow anthers. Average, upright and dense growth. E-M. Light fragrance. (Hybrid 'Scented Sun' x Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 1999 - J. Finlay).

name: Fine Pure

Very large, semidouble; petals in about three whorls, the inner incurved, the outer flat with emarginated apex. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' x Japonica 'Kona'). (U.S. 2007 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Finlandia

name: Finlandia Blush
description: ('Marie Griffin'). Blush Pink form of 'Finlandia'. (U.S. 1952 - Shepp).

name: Finlandia Red
description: ('Finlandia Rosea'; 'Aurora Rosea'; 'Pert'). Salmon Red form of 'Finlandia'.

name: Finlandia Rosea
description: See 'Finlandia Red'.

name: Finlandia Rosea Variegated
description: See 'King Lear'.

name: Finlandia Variegated
description: ('Margaret Jack'; 'Aurora Borealis'; 'Speckles'). Variegated variation of 'Finlandia' - White streaked Crimson. (Japan to U.S. - CA, 1910).

name: Fiona Capp
description: White. Large, single. Average, dense, spreading growth. E-M. (Aus. 1971 - R. Wilkins, Rosanna, Vic.).

name: Fircone
description: Blood Red. Miniature, semidouble similar to a fir cone. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Rhodellia).

name: Fircone Variegated
description: Blood Red and White variation of 'Fircone'.

name: Fire 'n Ice
description: Bright Red. Medium to large, semidouble to rose form double. Average, dense, upright growth. L. Cold hardy to -10°F. (Japonica "Tricolor [Siebold]' x Oleifera). (U.S. 1992 - Ackerman).

name: Fire Chief
description: Deep Red. Large, semidouble to peony form. Average, upright, spreading growth. L. (Japonica 'Donckelarii' x Reticulata 'Cornelian'). (U.S. 1963 - Asper).

name: Fire Chief Variegated
description: Deep Red moired White variation of 'Fire Chief'. "FIRST CLASS RED - Reticulata - ('Yipinhong' - Chinese Name). Light Red. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular center petals. L. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1980 - U. C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

name: Fire Dance
description: Deep Red. Medium, semidouble with narrow petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1979 - Nuccio's).

name: Fire Dance Variegated
description: Deep Red and White variation of 'Firedance'. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Fire Falls
description: Glowing Crimson. Medium to large, full peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1955 - Short).

name: Fire Frost
description: Center Soft Frosted Pink with White overtones blending to Dark to Medium Pink edges with Yellow anthers and White filaments. 15 ming left in chanter Small, loose peony form. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. M-L. (U.S. 2019 - Jill & Glenn Read, Lucedale, MS).

name: Firebird

name: Firebird Variegated
description: Satin Red blotched White variation of 'Firebird'.

name: Firebrand
description: Scarlet. Medium, semidouble with large petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Europe to U.S. [Magnolia] 1840's).

name: Firebrand Variegated
description: Scarlet blotched White form of 'Firebrand'.

name: Firecracker
description: Red hot Red. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1955 - McCaskill).

name: Firegold
description: See "Te Deum'.

name: Firelight
description: Deep Red. Large, single with bunched Pink anthers. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (Aus. 1969 - H. P. Matthews, East Brighton, Vic.).

name: Firey King
description: See 'C. M. Hovey'.

name: First Blush
description: Blush Pink edged Pink. Medium, formal double to rose form double. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1989 - Kramer).

name: First Flush
description: Blush Pink. Small, single. Vigorous, erect growth. E. (Probably C.x williamsii). (England to U.S. 1948 - Marchant, Keeper's Hill Nursery).

name: First Formal

name: First Lady

name: First Lady Bettyjean
description: Rose Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 2016 - Tsubaki Camellias, Savannah, GA).

name: First Love
description: Deep Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - F. T. Bergstrom, Pasadena, CA).

name: First Prom
description: White with Blush undertone. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1963 - Marshall).

name: Firstborn

name: Five Star General
description: Dark Red. Medium, loose peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1958 - Shackelford).

name: Five-O

name: Flame (Australia)

name: Flame Variegated

name: Flaming Youth
description: Light Red. Large, single. Vigorous, open growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Wild Form' seedling). (U.S. 1977 - Feathers).

name: Flamingo
description: Pale Pink. Medium, semidouble with petaloids sometimes mixed with stamens. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1948 - Rosa).

name: Flamingo Princess
description: Light Hot Pink with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Large, semidouble. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (Seedling of Reticulata 'Yinfen Mudan'). (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA). "FLAT DALI CAMELLIA - Reticulata - ('Pingban Dali Cha' - Chinese Name). Carmine. Large to very large, semidouble with wavy petals. E. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1980 - U. C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

name: Flashdance
description: White with Red and Pink stripes. Large, anemone form to peony form. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. (Aus. 1989 - D. Coe, Glenroy, Albury, NSW).

name: Fletcher Pearson Crown
description: Rose Pink. Medium, anemone form. Average growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959 - Mrs. A. A. Geiger, Atlanta, GA).

name: Fleurette
description: Rose Red. Miniature, formal double. Slow, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1945 - McCaskill).

name: Flicker
description: Crimson. Large, semidouble. Slow, compact growth. M- L. (U.S. 1951 - Hearn).

name: Flip
description: White or Pink spotted Red. Medium, formal double. Average, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1980 - Habel).

name: Flirtation
description: Silvery Pink. Medium, single. Compact, upright growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Lady Vansittart' x Saluenensis). (U.S. 1961 - Armstrong).

name: Flo-Adrian
description: White. Medium, formal double. Compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1976 - C. V. Bozeman, Hattiesburg, MS).

name: Flora Cooper
description: Pink. Small to medium, formal double occasionally rose form double. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1998 - W. Stout, Pensacola, FL).

name: Flora Ellen
description: White. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, open, pendulous growth. E-M. (U.S. 1952 - A. J. Parsons, Norfolk, VA).

name: Flora Eyster
description: White. Large, anemone form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1986 - Tammia).

name: Flora Hollingsworth
description: Light Pink. Medium, full peony form. Average, open growth. M. (U.S. 1957 - Magnolia).

name: Flora Mclendon Nelson
description: Pink. Small, formal double. Average, upright, willowy growth. (U.S. 2019 - Flora McLendon, Pontchatoula, LA).

name: Flora Nelson
description: Red. Small, formal double to rose form double. Average, upright, willowy growth. (U.S. 2019 - Flora McLendon, Pontchatoula, LA).

name: Flora Stout
description: Rose Pink veined Lighter Pink. Medium, semidouble.

name: Florabel
description: Rose Pink. Large, formal double. Average, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 1953 - Armstrong).

name: Floradora Girl
description: Light Blush Pink. Large, semidouble with wavy petals and trumpet of White stamens in center. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1961 - J. M. Hull, Mobile, AL).

name: Flore Celeste
description: See 'Aspasia Macarthur'.

name: Florence Coker Rogers
description: Pure White. Medium, formal double. E-M. (U.S. 1930's - Kalmia Gardens, Hartsville, SC).

name: Florence Daniel
description: Soft Pink. Miniature, anemone form. Slow, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1947 - McCaskill).

name: Florence Hollis
description: China White with White filaments. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1949 - J. L. Hand, Pelman, GA).

name: Florence Hudson
description: Blush Pink. Medium, anemone form. Vigorous, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1956 - Hudson).

name: Florence Jane
description: Blush Pink to White. Large, peony form. Vigorous, spreading growth. M-L. (Aus. 1973 - F. S. Spencer, Cheltenham, Vic.).

name: Florence Kirby
description: Dark Pink. Large to very large, formal double. M. (U.S. 1973 - Wilson).

name: Florence Stratton
description: White with some petals solid Pink. Medium to large, formal double to rose form double with cupped inner petals. Vigorous, bushy growth. L. (For another form of this cultivar see 'Sieur De Bienville'). (U.S. 1941 - Mcllhenny).

name: Florence Stratton Blush

name: Florence Wood
description: Deep Pink. Medium, full peony form. Average growth. E-M. (U.S. 1967 - C. D. Norwood, Thomasville, GA).

name: Florence's Debutante

name: Florence's Fancy Formal
description: Medium Pink. Medium, formal double form with pointed petals. Slow, upright, dense growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tiffany'). (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Florita

name: Florrie Burke
description: Light Salmon Pink. Medium to large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Saluenensis). (N.Z. 1984 - Mrs. F. E. Burke, Whakatane).

name: Florrie's Theme
description: Deep Salmon Pink. Large, formal double. Upright, open growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Florrie Burke' seedling). (N.Z. 1987 - M. Burke, Whakatane).

name: Flossie Goodson
description: Clear Pink. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1977 - C. Bozeman, Hattiesburg, MS).

name: Flossie Smith
description: Light Red. Medium, peony form. Average, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1964 - Smith's Nsy., Theodore, AL).

name: Flower Boy
description: Mauve Pink. Medium, rose form double. Open, spreading growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Flower Girl' seedling). (Aus. 1982 - Sebire).

name: Flower Girl
description: Pink. Large to very large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. (Oleifera 'Narumi-Gata' × Reticulata 'Cornelian'). (U.S. 1965 - Asper).

name: Flower Song
description: Salmon Rose Pink. Medium, formal double shaped like a dahlia. Average, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1955 - Short).

name: Flowerwood
description: ('Mathotiana Fimbriata'). Large, fimbriated. (Sport of Japonica 'Mathotiana'). (U.S. 1951 Domoto).

name: Flowerwood Variegated
description: Crimson spotted White variation of 'Flowerwood'.

name: Floy Johnston
description: Dark Red. Medium, semidouble. Compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1957 - Mrs. A. S. Behling, St. George, SC).

name: Floyd A. Rowe
description: Peppermint. Large, peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1975 - F. A. Rowe, Waverly, GA).

name: Floyd Magee
description: White. Large, peony form to anemone form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1977 - R. S. Magee, Bogalusa, LA).

name: Fluff

name: Fluted Orchid
description: Pale Orchid Pink. Medium, semidouble with fluted petals and central trumpet-shaped collection of petaloids and stamens. (Saluenensis x Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (U.S. 1960 - Feathers).

name: Fluted Silk
description: Pink with center petaloids tinged White. Very large, semidouble with irregular, wavy petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Shot Silk' seedling). (U.S. 1988 - Hall).

name: Fluted White
description: See 'Setsugekka'.

name: Fly Fly
description: ('Pian Pian' - Chinese Name). White center with outer petals Pink with White Picotee edges and sometimes petal veining can be observed. Large to very large, semidouble. Very bushy growth. M- L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' × Japonica 'Kona'). (U.S. 2012 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Flying Saucer
description: Bright Red. Medium, semidouble with three rows of wavy petals and stamens in center. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - Ashby).

name: Flynn Sans

name: Forest Fire

name: Forest Green
description: Red. Small to medium, formal double to rose form double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth with Dark Green foliage. M-L. (U.S. 1954 - Short).

name: Formality

name: Forrest's Royal Pearl

name: Fortieth Anniversary

name: Fortuna
description: Rose Red. Very large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' x Hybrid 'Donation'). (N.Z. 1980 - P. R. McNab, Levin).

name: Fortune Teller
description: Light Pink. Large, loose peony form with upright petals and intermingled petaloids and stamens. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1962 - Short).

name: Fortune's Smile

name: Forty-Niner
description: Brilliant Red. Medium to large, full peony form. Vigorous, spreading growth. E-M. (Reticulata 'Butterfly Wings' x Japonica 'Indian Summer'). (U.S. 1969 - Asper).

name: Four Winds
description: Orchid Pink. Large to very large, semidouble. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Japonica 'Tiffany'). (U.S. 1971 - Asper).

name: Fragrance
description: Light Rose. Medium, peony form. Average, compact growth. Fragrant. (U.S. 1955 - Mrs. H. C. Murphy, Moultrie, GA).

name: Fragrance Of Sleeve
description: Pale Pink veined Darker Pink. Miniature, single. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. Fragrant. (Japonica x Kissi). (U.S. 1983 - Ackerman).

name: Fragrant
description: Red. Large, full peony form. Spicy fragrance. (U.S. 1955).

name: Fragrant Asia
description: Bright Pink. Medium, single form. Average, upright growth. E-M. Strong fragrance. (Hybrid 'Fragrant One' x Japonica 'Scentasia'). (N.Z. 2002 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Boutonniere
description: Bright Red. Medium, peony form. Average, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (N.Z. 1991 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Burgundy
description: Dark Rose Red. Medium, peony form. Average density, upright growth. M-L. Rose and clove fragrance. (Hybrid 'Fragrant One' × Yuhsienensis'). (N.Z. 2002 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Cascade
description: Pale Pink. Medium, single. Average, dense, weeping growth. E-L. Fragrant. (Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' x 'King's Ransom' x Hybrid 'Scentuous'). (N.Z. 1993 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Concubine
description: Dark Pink with Yellow anthers. Medium, loose peony to semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth, E-M. Fragrance resembling woman's face power. (Hybrid 'Salab' × Japonica 'Tiffany'). (U.S. 1999 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Fragrant Dream
description: Soft Pink. Miniature to small, single. Vigorous, willowy, upright growth. E-M. Fragrant. (Hybrid 'Tiny Princess' x Lutchuensis). (Aus. 1989 - G. Hooper, Bexley North, NSW).

name: Fragrant Drift
description: China Rose Pink. Medium, peony form. Slow, dense, upright growth. M-L. Fragrant. (Hybrid 'Scentuous' seedling). (N.Z. 1993 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Fairies
description: Pale Blush Pink tinged Blush Mauve with an occasional stripe. Miniature, single with crepe and notched petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. Fragrant. (Hybrid 'Snow Drop' seedling). (Aus. 1994 - M. Baker, Macleod, Vic.).

name: Fragrant Frill
description: White, Blush or Pink. Large, anemone form. Compact growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1960 - E. Luce, Half Moon Bay, CA).

name: Fragrant Genesis
description: Bright Light Red. Medium, anemone to peony form. Average, upright growth. M. Light honeycomb fragrance. Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' x Hybrid 'Salab') × Japonica 'Tama-Ikari'] × Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 1999 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Girl
description: Shell Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. Fragrant. (U.S. 1992 - H. Hall).

name: Fragrant Jewel
description: Glowing bright Pink. Medium, rose form double to peony form. Average, upright growth. E-M. Strong carnation and clove fragrance. (Hybrid 'Fragrant One' × Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 2002 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Jonquil
description: White. Medium, anemone form resembling a jonquil. Vigorous, open growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1953 - Short).

name: Fragrant Joy
description: Dark Lavender Pink. Miniature, rose form double. Average, upright growth. E-M. Fragrant. (Rusticana x Lutchuensis). (U.S. 1983 - Ackerman).

name: Fragrant Lady
description: Ivory White with Pink flush on outer petals. Large, semidouble. M-L. Fragrant. (Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' × Hybrid 'Salab' × Japonica 'Erin Farmer'). (N.Z. 1996 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Legend
description: Bright Red. Large, peony form. Slow and spreading growth. E-M. Fragrant. (Hybrid 'Fragrant One' x Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 2002 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant One
description: Light Pink with Darker Pink petal tips shading to White in center. Large, single. Average, open, spreading growth. E-L. Fragrant. (Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' × Hybrid 'Salab'] x Japonica Tamaikari'). (N.Z. 1998 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Pathfinder
description: Deep Pink. Large, single. Average, spreading, open growth. E-M. Hay-like fragrance. (Hybrid 'Scented Sun' x Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 1999 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Pink
description: Deep Pink. Miniature, peony form. Average, spreading growth. E-L. Fragrant. (Rusticana x Lutchuensis). (U.S. 1968 - Ackerman).

name: Fragrant Pink Improved
description: Fragrant flowered polyploid variation of 'Fragrant Pink' produced by colchicine treatment. (U.S. 1975 - Ackerman).

name: Fragrant Pixies
description: Pale Pink shading to Deep Pink at outer edges. Miniature, single with notched petals. Slow, weeping growth. E. Fragrant. (Hybrid seedling). (Aus. 1995 - M. Baker, Macleod, Vic.).

name: Fragrant Ripple
description: White to very Light Pink, marked with Light Pink stripes and Darker Pink stripes. Medium, anemone form. Average, upright growth. M. Very light gardenia fragrance. (Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' × Hybrid 'Salab') x Japonica "Tama-Ikari'] x Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'. (N.Z. 1999 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Ruby
description: Red, darkening as flower matures. Large, peony form. Average, upright growth. E-M. Fragrant. (Hybrid 'Fragrant One' x Japonica 'Tama Glitters'). (N.Z. 2005 - J. Finlay).

name: Fragrant Star
description: White. Large, semidouble with long, narrow, upright center petals. Average, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1956 - B D. Colombo, Martinez, CA).

name: Fragrant Striped
description: See 'Colonial Lady'.

name: Fragrant Sweet
description: White. Medium, single. Fragrant.

name: Fran Blackwell
description: Bright Rose Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (Aus. 1983 - Mrs. E. M. Gulan, Arcadia, NSW).

name: Fran Boudolf
description: Light Pink to Darker Pink petal edges. Miniature, formal double. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1998 - E. Atkins, Shalimar, FL).

name: Fran Homeyer
description: Pearl Pink. Large, formal double. Average, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 1974 - Homeyer).

name: Fran Mathis
description: Champagne Pink. Medium to large, semidouble with eight rows of petals ruffled toward center. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1961 - Dr. W. F. Mathis, Moultrie, GA).

name: Fran Mathis Variegated
description: Champagne Pink and White variation of 'Fran Mathis'. (U.S. 1965 - Dr. W. F. Mathis, Moultrie, GA).

name: Frances
description: White. Small, semidouble. Compact, pendulous growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Miss H. Brandon, Thomasville, GA).

name: Frances B. Homer
description: Blush Pink. Large to very large, peony form. Average, spreading, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1978 - Homeyer).

name: Frances B. Muckenfuss
description: Light Pink shading Dark Pink on petal tips. Small to medium, peony form. Average, dense, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1999 - A. A. Muckenfuss Jr., Summerville, SC).

name: Frances Black
description: Pink to Pink and White. Large, rose form double. Average, spreading growth. E. (U.S. 1980 - Tammia).

name: Frances Boswell
description: Pink shading lighter. Large, rose form double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1973 - M. B. Boswell, Ocala, FL).

name: Frances Butler
description: Deep Coral Rose. Medium, semidouble of tulip form with notched petals. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1958 - Ragland).

name: Frances Council
description: White. Miniature to small, formal double. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1971 - Tammia).

name: Frances Garoni
description: Soft Rose Pink. Medium to large, loose peony form with twisted, fluted petals. Average, slightly pendulous growth. M-L. (U.S. 1957 - W. Garoni, Greenville, SC).

name: Frances Garoni Supreme
description: Soft Rose Pink blotched White with Golden anthers and Creamy Yellow filaments. Medium to large, loose peony form with twisted, fluted petals. Average, slightly pendulous growth. M-L. (Virus variegated form of Japonica 'Frances Garoni). (U.S. 1963).

name: Frances Hill
description: Light Pink. Large, loose peony form. M. (Aus. 1962 - Mrs. F. Hill, Warrawee).

name: Frances Howell
description: Light Red. Large, loose peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (U.S. 1964 - B. W. Howell, Thomasville, GA).

name: Frances Kryger
description: Rose Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1969 - L. Kryger, Pasadena, CA).

name: Frances Leonard
description: Shell to Coral Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, open growth. L. (U.S. 1954 - Turner).

name: Frances Lunsford
description: White. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1989 - Jernigan).

name: Frances M. Solomon
description: Soft Rose Pink. Large, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica 'Frau Geheimrat Oldevig'). (U.S. 1959 - Solomon).

name: Frances Mclanahan
description: Light Pink. Medium, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica 'Lady Vansittart'). (U.S. 1953 - D. C. Strother, Fort Valley, GA).

name: Frances Penton
description: Soft Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, open, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 1969 - Marbury).

name: Frances Sessions Hicks
description: White. Large, semidouble of fairly flat form with prominent stamens to full peony form. Average growth. M. (U.S. 1962 - R. D. Hicks, Troutville, VA).

name: Frances Upson
description: Silver Pink. Very large, semidouble. Average, open, upright growth. E-L. (Japonica Hybrid). (N.Z. 1981 - F. V. Upson, Kaponga).

name: Frances Wheaton
description: Dark Crimson shading lighter toward center. Large, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1959 - H. H. Wheaton, Fresno, CA).

name: Franceska Lawson
description: Blush White. Very large, rose form double. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1968 - Camelliana).

name: Francie L.
description: Rose Pink. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular, upright, wavy petals. (Saluenensis 'Apple Blossom' × Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha"). (U.S. 1964 - Nuccio's).

name: Francie L. Surprise
description: Rose Pink variegated White. Large to very large, peony form. (Sport of Reticulata hybrid 'Francie L'). (U.S. 1980 - C. X. Copeland, Jackson, MS).

name: Francie L. Variegated
description: Rose Pink and blotched White form of 'Francie L.. (U.S. 1970).

name: Francie L. White
description: White. Large to very large, semidouble. M- L. (Sport of Reticulata hybrid 'Francie L'.). (U.S. 1998 - Dr. Dan Nathan, Fort Valley, GA).

name: Francine
description: See 'Elegans (Chandler)'.

name: Francis Eugene Phillips
description: Soft Pink, bordered White. Large to very large, peony form. Vigorous, upright growth; very unusual holly- like foliage with heavy serrations. M-L. (U.S. - 1999, Gene Phillips, Gene's Nursery, Savannah, GA).

name: Francis Hanger
description: White. Medium, single with blooms up and down stems. Upright growth. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (England 1953 - Hanger).

name: Francis Rooney
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1954 - Turner).

name: Francois Wiot
description: ('Lady of The Lake [New Zealand]'). Crimson. Large, anemone form with Golden variegated foliage. (Belgium 1868).

name: Frand Sultan
description: ('Gran Sultanơ'). Dark Red. Large, semidouble to formal double. Slow, open growth. M-L. (For a variation of this cultivar see • 'Augusto L'Gouveia Pinto'). (Probably same as "Te Deum'). (Italy to Belgium [Verschaffelt] 1849).

name: Frank Baker
description: White. Medium, semidouble with irregular petals. Average, open growth. E-M. (U.S. 1950 - F. F. Baker, Jr., Macon, GA).

name: Frank Bisbee
description: White. Large, peony form to formal double. Average growth. E-M. (U.S. 1961 - F. Bisbee, Jacksonville, FL).

name: Frank Brownlee
description: Deep Red. Large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1965 - Mrs. R. F. Brownlee, Anderson, SC).

name: Frank Eidson
description: White splashed Pink and Red. Large, peony form. E. (For other forms of this cultivar see 'Blush Eidson', 'Rose Eidson'). (U.S. 1953 - F. V. Eidson, Thomasville, GA).

name: Frank Foote
description: Deep Pink. Large, semidouble with crepe and ruffled outer petals, fimbriated inner petals and a few petaloids among the stamens. (U.S. 1959 - Mrs. H. S. Hagerty, Hattiesburg, MS).

name: Frank Gibson
description: White with mass of White petaloids edged Yellow. Medium, anemone form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1951 - Mrs. F. L. Gibson, Thomasville, GA).

name: Frank Houser
description: Red. Very large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright, spreading, open growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' x Japonica 'Steve Blount'). (U.S. 1989 - Homeyer).

name: Frank Houser Variegated
description: Red and White form of 'Frank Houser'. (U.S. 1990 - Jernigan).

name: Frank Persons
description: White. Medium, peony form.

name: Frank Pursel
description: Red. Very large, heavy semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata/Japonica hybrid x Reticulata 'Cornelian'). (U.S. 1987 - Pursel).

name: Frank Robinson
description: Red. Large, semidouble. Compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1950 - Mrs. F. Robinson, Anderson, SC).

name: Frank Waghorn
description: Deep Pink. Miniature, single trumpet form with notched petals. Slow, open growth. E-L. (Pitardii seedling). (Aus. 1995 - K Brown, Mitcham, Vic.).

name: Frank Williams Jr.
description: Orange Red. Large, semidouble with fluted petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Similar to 'Red Wonder'). (U.S. 1952 - F. Williams, Beverly Hills, CA).

name: Frankie Winn
description: Pastel Pink. Large, full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1978 - Mrs. J. Luker, Savannah, GA).

name: Frankie Winn Variegated
description: Pastel Pink, blotched White variation of 'Frankie Winn'. (U.S. - 2000, W. C. Sutton, Savannah, GA).

name: Frau Geheimrat Oldevig
description: ('Mme. Chiang Kai-Shek'; 'Thomas Plant'). Deep Pink, sometimes mottled White. Medium, semidouble. Slow, compact growth. M. (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Frances M Solomon'). (Germany 1911 - Seidel).

name: Frau Minna Seidel
description: See 'Pink Perfection'. ('Frau Minna Seidel' is reported as priority name for this cultivar but as 'Pink Perfection' [U.S. 1890's - Domoto| has been in such common use in the U.S. we do not believe a change is necessary or warranted). (Germany 1893 - Seidel).

name: Freckles
description: White with Pink dots and flecks. Miniature, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1997 - Feathers).

name: Fred Gerald
description: Red and White. Large, loose peony form with serrated petals. Slow, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1968 - K. G. Durio, Jr., Opelousas, LA).

name: Fred Lee
description: Red. Large to very large, heavy semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata seedling). (U.S. 1985 - Pursel).

name: Fred Mayo
description: Bright Red. Medium, formal double with rose bud center. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. M-L. (U.S. 2007 - Fred Mayo, Fayetteville, NC).

name: Fred Parkes
description: Deep Pink. Very large, semidouble to loose peony form with fluted petals. Average, upright, spreading growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'William Hertrich' × Reticulata hybrid 'Mouchang'). (Aus. 1992 - E. Parkes, East Brighton, Vic.).

name: Fred S. Tuckfield
description: Rose Pink with deeper veining. Large, formal double to rose form double. Average, very bushy growth. L. (Reticulata 'Confucius' seedling). (Aus. 1968 - Tuckfield).

name: Fred Sander
description: ('Fimbriata Superba'). Crimson with curled, fimbriated petals. Medium, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica "Tricolor [Siebold]'). (For another form of this cultivar see 'Cinderella'). (Belgium 1913 - F. Sander, Brussels).

name: Fred Sander Variegated
description: ('Fimbriata Superba Variegated'). Crimson and White variation of 'Fred Sander'.

name: Fred Smith
description: Light Pink. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1957 - W. Smith, Statesboro, GA).

name: Fred Spencer
description: Dark Red. Very large, semidouble. Upright, compact growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' seedling). (Aus. 1980 - F. N. Spencer, Cheltenham, Vic.).

name: Fred's Choice
description: Pink. Miniature, semidouble. Upright growth. M. (U.S. 1960's - F. Hamilton, Santa Maria, CA).

name: Freda Howell Variegated
description: Deep Pink variegated White with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 2016 - Howell).

name: Freddie Mac
description: Vibrant Red with Yellow anthers and Pink filaments. Medium to large, semidouble form. Vigorous, upright, open growth. M-L. (U.S. 2021 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Frederick Beck
description: Brick Red. Large, single with six petals and Dark Yellow stamens. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1953 - F. Beck, Shreveport, LA).

name: Freedom Bell
description: Bright Red. Small, bell shaped semidouble. Vigorous, upright, compact growth. E-M. (U.S. 1965 - Nuccio's).

name: Fregeo
description: Pink, notched petals with Deeper Pink Stripes. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright, bushy growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Phyl Doak' seedling). (Aus. 1998 - ACRS W. A. Branch).

name: French Vanilla
description: Creamy White. Large, single.

name: Freyda
description: Light Rose Pink with some petaloids showing White. Medium, rose form double with some outside notched petals.

name: Friendly Skies
description: Rose Pink with slightly lighter margination. Large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E. (Reticulata hybrid). (U.S. 1980 - Feathers).

name: Friendship
description: White. Large, tiered semidouble. Vigorous growth. M-L. (U.S. 1960 - Feathers).

name: Frilled White
description: White. Medium, semidouble with frilled petals. 6 mine left in chanter FROSTED PINK - Formerly Hiemalis - Blush Pink with frosted cast on petals. Medium, formal double. Upright spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 2000 - A. Landry, Baton Rouge, LA).

name: Frilly One
description: Creamy White with Gold anthers and Yellow filaments. Medium, full peony to loose peony form. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (Seedling of Non-reticulata hybrid 'Jury's Yellow'). (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Fritz Taylor
description: White graduating to Deep Pink on outer petals. Medium, formal double with small, cupped petals. Slow, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1955 - Mrs. A. M. Nickerson, Norfolk, VA).

name: Frizzle White
description: ('Susan Carter'). White. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Vigorous, spreading growth. M. (A form sport of this cultivar is 'Feathery Touch'). (U.S. 1935 - Overlook).

name: Frolic
description: White with touch of Pink. Miniature, single. Slow, spreading growth. E-L. (Rosaeflora seedling). (N.Z. 1990 - P. Austin).

name: Frost Prince
description: Deep Pink. Medium, single. Average, upright growth. E. (Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' × Oleifera). (U.S. 1978 - Ackerman).

name: Frost Princess
description: Lavender Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average growth. E. (Sasanqua 'Bill Wylam' x Oleifera). (U.S. 1981 - Ackerman).

name: Frost Queen
description: White. Large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E-L. Cold hardy to -5°F. (U.S. 1971 - U.S. Dept. of Agr., Glenn Dale, MD).

name: Frosty
description: White. Medium, semidouble with irregular petals.

name: Frosty Morn
description: White. Large, anemone form. Average, open growth. M-L. (U.S. 1950 - Short).

name: Froth
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble to peony form. Slow growth. M. (Hybrid 'Elegant Beauty' × Hybrid 'Donation'). (N.Z. 1980 - P. R. McNab, Levin).

name: Fu Dei Qiuan
description: See 'Butterfly Spring'.

name: Fuchsia
description: Fuchsia with Gold anthers and Pinkish filaments. Medium, single. Average, upright, spreading growth. M-L. (Seedling of Reticulata hybrid 'Mark Cannon'). (U.S. 2016 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Fuiri-Kocho-Wabisuke
description: Variegated leaf form of 'Kocho- Wabisuke'.

name: Fuji
description: White changing to Soft Pink. Large, single with flared Pale Yellow stamens. See Higo.

name: Fuji-No-Mine
description: White. Medium, rose form double. FUJI-NO-YUKI - Formerly Hiemalis - White, Blush on tips when beginning to bloom with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Large, semidouble. E. (Japan 1957 - Matasaburô Tsuda, Kumamoto Prefecture).

name: Fuji-No-Yuki
description: (Snow on Mt. Fujiyama). White. Medium, single. See 'Higo'.

name: Fukurin Wabisuke
description: Light Pink bordered White. Small, single. Medium, upright growth. E-M.

name: Fukurin-Ikkyu
description: White or Pale Pink, shaded Deeper Pink with a White border, or Red in various degrees up to Solid Red with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Miniature, semidouble with foliage bordered Light Green. L. (Sport of Rusticana 'Komomiji). (Japan - Kantô area to U.S. 1930 - Star Nursery, Sierra Madre, CA).

name: Fukutsuzumi (Fortune's Hand Drum)
description: Dark Red petals mottled White with Yellow anthers and Red filaments. Small, single. Medium, somewhat open growth. M. (A variegated form of Japonica 'Kuro- wabisuke'). (Japan 1971-Andoh).

name: Fukuzutsumi
description: White shaded Rose Pink. Medium, single to semidouble.

name: Full House
description: White occasionally streaked or splotched Pink. Large, rose form double, often showing tuft of small petaloids in center. Willowy growth. M. (U.S. 1960 - Ashby).

name: Funny Face Betty
description: ('Charming Betty'). Pale Pink that turns Darker Pink and then Pale Pink again. Medium to large, semidouble to loose peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Betty Sheffield). (U.S. 1961 - Tammia).

name: Fuyajo
description: ('Pupurea'). Black Red. Small, single. (Japan 1935 - Chugai).

name: G. W. Ellis
description: Rose Pink flecked White. Large, formal double to rose form double. Average, compact growth. M-L. (Similar to 'Rosea Superba'"). (U.S. 1945 - Huested).

name: Gabbie Laver
description: Light Red. Medium, anemone form. Compact growth. E-M. (Aus. 1983 - R. Hawkes, Woodside, SAAC).

name: Gabriel Lewis
description: Light Pink with Gold anthers. Large, rose form double to semidouble. Average, upright growth. E-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Marie Bracey'). (U.S. 2016 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Gabriel Maphis
description: Bright Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Large to very large, loose peony form. Vigorous, upright, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Reticulata Hybrid 'Curtain Call'). (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Gabriel's Blush
description: Blushing White. Large, formal double to rose form double. Average, upright, open growth. E-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Snow Lady'). (U.S. 2016 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Gael's Dream
description: Soft Rose Pink shading to Carmine. Very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (Reticulata hybrid 'Dream Girl' × Reticulata). (N.Z. 1987 - T. Lennard, Te Puke).

name: Gaiety
description: See 'Gigantea'. (Not the cultivar listed in old literature, which was an anemone form of White striped Pink).

name: Gail
description: Deep Pink. Medium, semidouble with upright petals. Average, spreading growth. E. (U.S. 1959 - Wells).

name: Gail Evans
description: Blush Pink. Large, semidouble with inner folded petals and Blonde stamens. Vigorous, upright, open growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - Ragland).

name: Gail Hooks
description: Crimson. Medium, formal double. Average, dense growth. L. (U.S. 2006 - Etha Prickett Carson, Augusta, GA).

name: Gail Phelan
description: Deep Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, dense, upright growth. L. Cold hardy. (U.S. 1995 - Dr. C. Minarik, West Harwich, MA).

name: Gainsborough
description: Red. Very large, loose peony form. Average, open growth. M. (Reticulata 'Confucius' seedling). (Aus. 1971 - Tuckfield).

name: Galaxie
description: White striped Reddish Pink. Medium, semidouble sometimes with cupped o r twisted upright petals. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis x Japonica 'Finlandia Variegated'). (U.S. 1963 - Metcalf).

name: Galilee
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble with loose, upright petals. Vigorous, compact, slender growth. M. (U.S. 1943 - Fruitland).

name: Galilee Variegated
description: Pink and White form of 'Galilee'.

name: Gallant Array
description: Rich Dark Red. Medium to large, loose peony form. Vigorous, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1958 - Short).

name: Gallic Moods
description: Varicolored changing from White to Pink to Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1973 - Witman).

name: Garden Glory
description: Rich Orchid Pink. Medium, rose form double to formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (Saluenensis × Japonica). (U.S. 1974 - Nuccio's).

name: Garden Party
description: Light Pink in the center to Deeper Medium Pink on the edges. with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Large to very large, full peony to loose peony form. Average, upright, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Elegans Miniata'). (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Garden Rose
description: Medium Pink with Light Yellow anthers and Creamy Yellow filaments. Large, semidouble form. Average, upright, spreading growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Grand Finale'). (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Gardenia (Bradford)
description: White. Miniature, full peony form. Compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1935 - Bradford).

name: Garnet Gleam
description: Vivid Garnet Red. Small to medium, trumpet shaped single with Pink filaments and Golden stamens. Slow, spreading growth. E-L. (Pitardii × Pitardii/Japonica seedling). (N.Z. 1980 - Mrs. A. B Durrant, Rotorua).

name: Garnett Avant
description: White. Medium, formal double. Average, spreading, dense growth. E-M. (U.S. 2017 - Randolph Maphis, Tallahassee FL).

name: Gary's Red
description: Turkey Red edged Purple. Medium, semidouble with Golden anthers and bright Red filaments. Average, open, upright growth. E- M. (U.S. 1966 - Stone).

name: Gary's Red Variegated
description: Turkey Red and White variation of 'Gary's Red'. (U.S. 1970).

name: Gate Of Heaven
description: Pink with White radiating from center. Medium, semidouble. M. (U.S. 1952 - Baker).

name: Gauntlettii
description: See 'Lotus'. ('Gauntletti' is reported as priority name for this cultivar over 'Sode-Gakushi, but as 'Lotus' has been in such common use in the U.S. we do not believe a change is necessary or warranted).

name: Gay

GREEN'S BLUES - Formerly Hiemalis - Violet Purple, aging to Blue; the unique color is not dependent on cold weather. Miniature to small, rose form double. (U.S. 2004 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Governor Earl Warren

name: Governor Earl Warren Variegated

name: Governor Kennon

name: Governor Lester Maddox

Some cultivars have stamens topped with petaloids. Cultivars are listed by name with description as to color, size and form with reference to Higo. (Japan 1800's - Kumamoto).

Large to very large, rose form double to semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' × Japonica 'Kona'). (U.S. 2007 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

description: Dark Red with Gold stamens. Large, peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Mouchang' seedling). (Aus. 2007 - Keith Abbott, Rossmoyne). semidouble with upright, notched inner petals. Upright, spreading growth. M-L. (Reticulata seedling). (Aus. 1980 - A. Spragg, Sutherland, NSW).

name: Kelly Gaye
description: Bright Pink. Medium to large, formal double. Average, compact growth. M-L. (N.Z. 1985 - A. Webster, Te Puke).

name: Kelly's Eye

name: Kenbaranne

name: Kenny

Medium, cup-shaped single. Slow spreading growth. M-L. (Japonica, Nitidissima, Reticulata in background). (U.S. - Nuccio's Hybridizer Kazuo Yoshikawa, Japan). KI-NO-MOTO#95 - Reticulata - Light Yellow. Large, semidouble. Slow, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'LASCA Beauty' × Japonica). (U.S. - Nuccio's Hybridizer Kazuo Yoshikawa, Japan).

name: Kevin Murphy

KIFUKURIN BENIKARATO (YELLOW BORDERED RED ANEMONE) - Japonica - Red. Miniature to small, anemone form flower with a tight, tufted center and five outer petals. Compact, upright growth with variegated Yellowish Green on Mid-Green leaves. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'Benikarako'). (Replaces KI-FUKURIN-BENTEN). (Japan 1859 - Kantô area).

name: Kiho

name: King Lear

MAGNOLIA QUEEN - ('Priscilla Brooks'). White striped Red. Large, semidouble with irregular petals. Average, bushy growth. L. (U.S. Early 1900's - Magnolia). MAGNOLIAEFLORA - ('Hagoromo'; 'Rose of Dawn'; 'Cho-No-Hagasane'). Blush Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, compact growth. M. (Variations of this cultivar include 'Arthur Bolton' and 'Rudy's Magnoliaeflora'). (Japan to Italy 1886). MAHOGANY GLOW - Dark Red. Small to medium, semidouble with smaller petals toward center and Red foliage. L. (U.S. 1953 - Short). MAHOROBA (EXCELLENT COUNTRY) - Deep Pink bordered White. Medium, formal double, imbricated petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Japonica 'Benihagoromo' × Japonica 'Etenraku'). (Japan 2007 - Soshin Harai).

name: Mathotiana

Large to very large, rose form double to formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. Cold hardy. ('Variations of this cultivar include 'Flowerwood'; 'Sultana'; 'Red Wonder'; 'Rosea Superba'). (Not same as cultivar listed in old literature, which was a very large Red formal double). (Europe to U.S. - [Magnolia] 1840's).

name: Mathotiana Alba

name: Reland Westate

name: Remey

(U.S. 1989 - Homeyer). *RETICULATE LEAF CRIMSON - Reticulata - ('Maye Taohong' - Chinese Name'; 'Professor Tsai'). Delicate Rose Pink, often fading to Silver-Pink at center. Medium, semidouble with open tiers of waved petals surrounding center of petaloids with a few stamens. Average growth. M-L. (China - there is an old tree at the Panlong Temple estimated to be over 600 years old - Kunming, Yunnan). *RETICULATE LEAF PINK - Reticulata - ('Maye Yinhong' - Chinese Name). Bright Spinel Pink with Red veins. Medium, semidouble with irregular, loose petals. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to N.Z. 1964 - Durrant).

(Sasanqua 'Shishi- Gashira' seedling). (U.S. 1992 - Tom Dodd Nsy., Semmes, AL).
