description: Pink. Medium, single of tulip form. Average, pendulous growth. M. (U.S. 1951 - Short).

name: Sweet Auburn
description: RHSCC 66D, moderate Purplish Pink, with Yellow anthers and Yellow-White filaments. Very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 2014 - Unknown origin, Auburn, AL).

name: Sweet Bonair
description: Cream White. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1952 - Goletto).

name: Sweet Cecile
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble with veined petals. Average, willowy growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959).

name: Sweet Deborah Jane
description: Outer petals are mid Pink at the edges, shading to Light Pink at center and innermost petals a Pale Creamy Pink. Large, rose form double to peony form. Average growth. M-L. Fragrant. (Hybrid 'Fragrant One' x Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 2002 - J. Finlay).

name: Sweet Delight
description: Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, loose, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1937 - Reeves).

name: Sweet Dreams
description: Pale Orchid Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1984 - Nuccio's).

name: Sweet Emily Kate
description: Light Pink shading to Pale Pink in center. Small to medium, full peony form. Slow, pendulous growth. M-L. Fragrant. (Japonica x Lutchuensis). (Aus. 1987 - R. Garnett, Beaumaris, Vic.).

name: Sweet Emma
description: White with outer petals flushed Pink. Medium to large, anemone form. E. Fragrant. (Japonica "Tamaikari' × Japonica Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' × Hybrid 'Salab'). (N.Z. 1996 - J. Finlay).

name: Sweet Gem
description: Lavender Pink with Yellow anthers and Light Yellow filaments. Miniature, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Kuro-tsubaki' × species from Section Theopsis). (China 2009 - Jian-Guo Fei, Yong-hong Hu and Ya-li Zhang, Shanghai Botanical Garden of Shanghai, China).

name: Sweet Jane
description: Pale Pink center shading to Deeper Pink on outer petals. Miniature, peony form to formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Japonica 'Edith Linton' × Transnokoensis). (Aus. 1992 - R. Garnett, Beaumaris, Vic.).

name: Sweet Lara
description: Red. Medium, formal double. Average open spreading growth. E-M. Cold hardy. (U.S. 2000 - V. Stone, Baton Rouge, LA).

name: Sweet Mary
description: Blush Pink center petals darkening to Shell Pink on the outer petals. Medium, formal double having a swirled pattern about 40% of the time. Average, upright, dense growth. E. (U.S. 2019 - Mickey Moore, Americus, GA).

name: Sweet October
description: White with Golden Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Small to medium, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (Oleifera 'Lu Shan Snow' x Sasanqua 'White Queen'). (U.S. 2009 - Ackerman).

name: Sweet Olive
description: Pink. Small, formal double. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1990 - T. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Sweet Scented
description: Bright Pink. Medium, semidouble form. Average growth. Fragrant, reminiscent of tea. (Japonica [Higo] 'Mikuni-no-homare' x Hybrid 'High Fragrance'). (N.Z. 2002 - J. Finlay).

name: Sweet Scentsation
description: Dark Orchid Pink edges fading to Blush Pink with White overtones with a center of a mixture of Dark Orchid Pink 1 minute left in chanter and Blush Pink with White overtones with Golden anthers and Golden filaments. Large, loose peony to semidouble with upright petals. Vigorous, upright, open growth. E-M. Very fragrant. (U.S. 2016 - Jill Read, Lucedale, MS).

name: Sweet Sheree
description: Magenta Rose. Medium, semidouble.

name: Sweet Sixteen
description: Light Pink. Medium, semidouble with stamens tipped with Green anthers. Average, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1949 - Domoto).

name: Sweet Sue
description: Red. Large, semidouble with irregular petals to full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1956 - Hudson).

name: Sweet William
description: Bright Pink. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Dream Girl' seedling). (U.S. 2008 - CamelliaShop, Savannah, GA).

name: Sweet Young Thing
description: Pale Pink with Lavender cast overlaid with Deep Rose. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1957 - McCaskill).

name: Sweetbird Of Youth
description: Lavender Pink. Large, semidouble with Golden stamens and petaloids intermixed. Vigorous, compact growth. E-M. (Hybrid I. C. Williams' seedling). (U.S. 1960 - R. Carr, Tulare, CA).

name: Sweetheart
description: Soft Apricot Pink, occasionally marbled White. Medium, rose form double. (Sport of Japonica 'Bleichroeder Pink'). (U.S. 1958 - Arnesen).

name: Sweetie Pie
description: Blush Pink with one or more Red stripes. Large to very large, semidouble with occasional rabbit ears. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1997 - D. Fitzgerald, Orlando, FL).

name: Sweetie Pie Red
description: Mauve Red with Creamy Golden anthers and Creamy Golden filaments. Large to very large, semidouble. Rapid, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (Color sport of Japonica 'Sweetie Pie'). (U.S. 2005 - Jerry Conrad, Plymouth, FL).

name: Sweetii Vera
description: ('Lewellyn Variegated'). White and pale Pink. Medium to large, peony form. Vigorous, upright, open growth. M. (England 1832 - Sweet).

name: Swirling Cloud
description: White. Large, semidouble with loose petals. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1955 - Feathers).

name: Sydney Woodroffe
description: Deep Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' seedling). (N.Z. 1981 - Mrs. A. B. Durrant and Mrs. D. Johnson, Rotorua).

name: Sylphide
description: Pink. Medium, peony form. M. (Aus. 1962 - G Waterhouse).

name: Sylvia May
description: Pale Pink. Medium, single with long, narrow petals. Slow, open, upright growth. M. (Cuspidata × Saluenensis). (England to U.S. 1950 - Dr. W. Wells, Oakland, CA).

name: Sylvia May Wells
description: Pale Blush shaded to Light Lavender Pink. Large, loose peony form. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1966 - H. L. Paige, Lafayette, CA).

name: Symphonette
description: Bright Red. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1946 - Fruitland).

name: T'Ang
description: Lavender Pink. Large, semidouble with irregular, upright, wavy petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' seedling). (U.S. 1966 - E. Rideout, Laguna Hills, CA).

name: T's Rose
description: Dark Velvet Red with Yellow anthers and Red filaments. Small, formal double to rose form double with fully imbricated mid-season to late blooms; late season blooms are rose form double. Slow, bushy, medium density growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Royal Velvet'). (U.S. 2022 - John Davy, Pace, FL).

name: T. C. Patin
description: Light Red. Very large, full semidouble with irregular, large petals and spray of large stamens. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1974 - T. C. Patin, Hammond, LA).

name: T. C. Patin Variegated
description: Light Red blotched and marked White variation of 'T C Patin'. (U.S. 1974 - T. C. Patin, Hammond, LA).

name: T. Morris
description: Medium Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Large, semidouble to rose form double. Vigorous, upright, medium density growth. M. (Seedling of Reticulata hybrid 'Nuccio's Ruby). (U.S. 2023 - Jim Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: T. P. Bowen
description: White with Blush Pink iridescent undertone. Miniature, formal double. Bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1977 - Haynie).

name: T. S. Clower, Jr.
description: White with narrow Pink stripe. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, slender, open growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Clower).

name: Tabbs
description: Crimson marbled and blotched White. Medium to large, full peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Helenor'). (Aus. 1856 - Guilfoyle).

name: Tabitha
description: Light Pink flushed Rose; sports White streaked Deep Rose or Red, Fuchsia, and Fuchsia with one White petal. Large, semidouble. Spreading, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1963 - Mrs. K. H. McEachern, Wilmington, NC).

name: Tada Meibi
description: Rose overcast Salmon. Miniature, formal double with incurved center petals. Slow growth. E-M. (U.S. 1986 - Stone).

name: Taffeta Tutu
description: Apricot Pink with Pink petal edges blending to Lemon Yellow at center. Large, semidouble to loose peony form with upright petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1959 - Dr. L. W. Fawns, Fresno, CA).

name: Tafuku-Benten (Happy Goddess)
description: ('Benten-tsubaki'; 'Otafuku-benten'). Pink blotched and edged White. Medium, single. Vigorous, spreading growth. M. (Japan 1956 - E. Satomi, Tokyo).

name: Tahiti
description: Bright Red. Medium, single with splayed stamens. Vigorous, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (Aus. 1959 - G. Waterhouse).

name: Tai-Tai
description: Pink. Medium to large, formal double. Vigorous, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 1966 - J. P. Woo, Fresno, CA).

name: Taihai
description: See 'Osakazuki'.

name: Taiheiraku
description: See 'Daitairin'.

name: Taishuhai
description: White shading to Deep Red on edge. Medium to large, single.

name: Takane-No-Yuki
description: Soft Pink petals, veined Deeper Pink with wide, White center, with Gold anthers and White filaments. Medium, single with crinkled edges. (Japan 1931 - Tôbei Yoshida, Kiso River, Chûbu).

name: Takanini
description: Deep Purplish Red. Small to medium, semidouble, anemone form centered. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (N.Z. 1989 - Haydon).

name: Takara-Awase (Treasure Trove)
description: Pink shaded White and bordered Pink. Unknown size, semidouble.

name: Takueiyeh
description: See 'Large Osmanthus Leaf'. *TALI QUEEN - Reticulata - ('Dali Cha' - Chinese Name). Turkey Red to Deep Pink. Very large, semidouble with irregular petals and with very large, heavily textured outer petals and wavy inner petals interspersed with clusters of stamens. Average, upright growth. M. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1948 - Descanso and Peer).

name: Tallahassee Girl
description: Blush Pink. Medium, semidouble to peony form. Upright growth. M. (U.S. 1948 - Rosa).

name: Talmont
description: White. Large, formal double. Average, spreading, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1967 - Mrs. W. P. Bevis, Tallahassee, FL).

name: Tam O'Shanter
description: Deep Rose outer petals and dainty Pink center petals. Medium to large, rose form double. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1967 - Haynie).

name: Tama Americana
description: Rose Red with broad White border. Medium, semidouble with occasional petaloids. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Anemone
description: Rose Red with White border, irregular but usually narrow with Golden anthers and White filaments. medium, anemone form. Average, compact, rounded growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica "Tama-no-ura'). (U.S. 2021 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Tama Bambino
description: Rose Pink bordered White. Miniature to small, peony form with narrow, pointed petals. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Beauty
description: Rose Pink bordered White. Medium to large, loose peony form. Average, dense growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Bell
description: White with Red at base of petals. Miniature to small, bell-shaped single. Vigorous, loose, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Carousel
description: Pink with a White border. Medium, semidouble with center petals that standup and occasional petaloids. Medium, upright, bushy growth. E-M. (Japonica "Tama-no-ura' × Japonica 'Nuccio's Carousel'). (U.S. 2014 - Bradford King, Arcadia, CA).

name: Tama Electra
description: Brilliant Dark Red bordered White. Small to medium, single. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Glitters
description: Red bordered White. Medium to large, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, spreading, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Loch Laurel
description: Red with White border around petals with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, loose peony to semidouble with petals in center of flower are narrow, similar to petaloids. Average, upright growth. M. (Japonica 'Tama Electra' seedling). (U.S. 2016 - Mark Crawford, Valdosta, GA).

name: Tama Peacock
description: Maroonish Red washing to a White border. Small to medium, semidouble form. Upright, pendulous growth. M-L. (U.S. 2000 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Velvet
description: Dark Red with a White border of varying width with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tama-no-ura'). (U.S. 2018 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Vino
description: Wine Red washing to broad White border. Small to medium, semidouble with long, narrow petals. Average, upright growth. E- M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama-Ikari
description: Light Pink. Medium, single with circular Pale Yellow stamens. See Higo.

name: Tama-No-Ura
description: Red bordered White. Small to medium, single. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Japan 1973 to U.S. 1978 - Nuccio's).

name: Tamagasumi
description: Faint Blush Pink with slender flecks of Red with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, single opening to a spherical/ cupped shape. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tar'an'). (Japan 1968 - Shun'ichi Sakuragi, Chûbu Area).

name: Tamborine's Jewel
description: Fuchsine Pink. Medium, semidouble; 19-20 petals in 3 tiers. Average, broad, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1999 - Kevin J. Coase, Tamborine Mtn., Qld.).

name: Tamie Fraser
description: Pale Pink center shading to Deeper Pink on outer petal edges. Large, anemone form to peony form. Average, dense, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1989 - M. Fraser, Nareen, Vic.).

name: Tamlin Fortner
description: Dark Red with Yellow anthers and Red filaments. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Scarlet Glory'). (U.S. 2017 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, (A).

name: Tammia
description: White with Pink center and border. Miniature to small, formal double with incurved geometric petals. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1971 - Tammia).

name: Tammia Blush
description: Blush Pink center with Darker Pink border. (Sport of Japonica 'Tammia'). (U.S. 1977 - Tammia).

name: Tammia Fire Opal
description: White flecked and streaked radiant Scarlet. (Sport of Japonica 'Tammia'). (U.S. 1978 - J L Carvain, Dallas, TX).

name: Tammia Speckled
description: White with sunken center and border, with Red speckles. Miniature to small, formal double with incurved geometric petals. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'Tammia').

name: Tammy
description: Bright Pink. Large, formal double. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. E-M. (U.S. 2013 - Howell).

name: Tamzin Coull
description: Deep Pink. Large, rose form double. Open, upright growth. M. (N.Z. 1980 - Mrs. B. J. Rayner, Stratford).

name: Tancho
description: White streaked Crimson. Medium, single. See Higo.

name: Tango
description: Black Red Crimson. Large to very large, formal double. Average, dense, spreading, upright growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Carl Tourje' × Reticulata hybrid 'Craig Clark'). (U.S. 1996 - Hall).

name: Tanya
description: Deep Rose Pink. Small, single.

name: Tar Baby
description: Blood Red. Medium, anemone form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1985 - Dr. M. B. Wine, Thomasville, GA).

name: Tarantella
description: Vibrant Red with Bright Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Medium, peony form. Vigorous, upright, average density growth. E-M. [(Sasanqua x Reticulata hybrid 'Gael's Dream') x Japonica 'Takanini']. (New Zealand, 2008 - Neville Hayden, Takanini).

name: Taro-An (Name Given To Japanese Tea House)
description: Soft Pink. Medium, single with large, round petals and heavy stamens of magnolia form. Vigorous growth. E-M. (Japan 1936 - Chugai).

name: Taro-Kaja
description: ('Judith'). Pink. Small, single bell form.

name: Tasasago
description: Pale Pink. Medium, single with flared Pale Yellow stamens. See Higo.

name: Tashiro
description: White. Medium, rose form double.

name: Tata
description: White. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1991 - Nuccio's).

name: Tatters
description: White. Medium, peony form. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (Aus. 1962 - Waterhouse).

name: Taylor Maid
description: Bright Pink. Large, anemone form. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (Saluenensis × Japonica). (N.Z. 1984 - J. Taylor, Alton, Taranaki).

name: Taylor's Perfection
description: Light Pink. Large, semidouble with occasional petaloids. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis seedling). (N.Z. 1975 - J. Taylor, Alton).

name: Taylor's Supreme
description: Rose Pink. Large, semidouble with some petaloids. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis seedling). (N.Z. 1975 - J. Taylor, Alton).

name: Te Deum
description: ('Dr. Shepherd'; 'Firegold'; 'Morague'; 'Pasha of Persia'; 'Shah of Persia'). Dark Red. Large, semidouble to formal double. Slow, open growth. M-L. (Probably same as cultivar 'Grand Sultan' which would have priority but, as "Te Deum' has been in such common use in the US, we do not believe a change is necessary or warranted). (Europe to U.S. 1890 - Tea Gardens).

name: Tea Garden 45
description: Dark Red. Medium, semidouble of cupped form Vigorous, compact growth. L. (U.S. 1942 - Tea Gardens).

name: Teckla
description: Coral Pink. Medium, semidouble with crepe petals. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1958 - E. L. Stelling, Augusta, GA).

name: Teckla Variegated
description: Deep Pink and White variation of "Teckla'.

name: Ted Craig
description: Red. Very large, semidouble. Average, spreading, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'William Hertrich' × Japonica 'Drama Girl'). (Aus. 1993 - I. Craig, N. Bondi, NSW).

name: Ted Kohl
description: Rose Red. Large, full semidouble. Average, compact growth. (U.S. 1958 - J. W. Bradford, San Diego, CA).

name: Ted Kohl Variegated
description: Rose Red heavily blotched White variation of "Ted Kohl.'.

name: Tedd Gilley
description: Dark Red. Large, loose peony form. Average, spreading, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1973 - Gilley).

name: Teddie Ulmer
description: Deep Red. Medium to large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1972 - Mealing).

name: Teddy, Jr.
description: Fuchsia Pink. Small, semidouble to rose form double with small upright petaloids with lily-like tops. (U.S. 1961 - F. Griffin, Sr., Columbia, SC).

name: Tee Bird
description: Pink with Red stripes and flecks. Small, formal double; the bloom has a large center bud. Average, upright, dense growth. L. (U.S. 2016 - Howell).

name: Teen Age Queen
description: Blush Pink usually with one small Pink tripe. Large, thick semidouble. Compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1969 Shackelford).

name: Teenager
description: Rose Pink. Medium, single.

name: Telstar
description: White, inside Light Pink to Dark Pink with Rose border. Medium, semidouble with crinkled petals.

name: Temple Bowen
description: Deep Red. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/ Non-Reticulata hybrid). (U.S. 1981 - Pursel).

name: Temple Festival
description: Red. Very large, semidouble. Average, open growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' × Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (N.Z. 1972 - D. G. O'Toole, Ohope).

name: Temple Garden
description: Deep Pink. Very large, peony form with fluted and wavy petals. Vigorous, open growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Lila Naff' seedling). (Aus. 1986 - B. Hooper, Bexley North, NSW).

name: Temple Mist
description: Rose Pink with iridescent petals. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular petals. Average, upright growth. M. (Reticulata × Japonica). (U.S. 1967 - Maitland).

name: Temptation
description: White Blushed Pink on petal edges. Medium, single.

name: Ten Below
description: Bright Red. Large, semidouble. M. Cold hardy. (U.S. 1960 - Ashby).

name: Ten Plus
description: Pink with mottled Whitish Pink center petals. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/Japonica hybrid). (U.S. 1980 - Pursel).

name: Tenju
description: Blush Pink. Medium to large, wavy petaled single with flared Pale Yellow stamens. See Higo.

name: Tennin-Kwan
description: See 'Nagasaki'.

name: Teresa Ragland
description: Deep Coral Pink with White stamens. Large, semidouble with six separated fascicles of stamens in a circle spreading over petals and small, folded, swirled petals in center of incurved stamens. Average, open growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - Ragland).

name: Teringa
description: Crimson. Large, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Aus. 1955 - Turnbull).

name: Terrell Weaver
description: Flame to Dark Red. Large to very large, semidouble to loose peony form with thick fluted and twisted petals. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Japonica 'Ville De Nantes'). (U.S. 1974 - Homeyer).

name: Terry Clayton Newell
description: Light Pink. Large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1966 - Bray).

name: Terry Gilley
description: Brilliant Red with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Dr. W. G. Lee' x Japonica 'Tomorrow's Dawn'). (U.S. 1974 - Gilley).

name: Terrye Eller
description: Light Blush Pink with Darker Pink margins and suffused Darker Pink. Small, rose form double. Average growth. E-M. (U.S. 1960 - J. E. Miller, New Orleans, LA).

name: Thai Silk
description: Salmon Pink. Medium, single with crepe and crinkled petals. Slow, dwarf, bushy growth. E-M. (Reticulata seedling). (U.S. 1992 - Nuccio's).

name: Thalia
description: White flower with outer half suffused with Pink. Miniature, loose peony to rose form double. Dense, semi-dwarf growth. E- M. (U.S. 1996 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Thanksgiving
description: Turkey Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, open growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959 - H. Larson, Orange, CA).

name: The Bride
description: Blush Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous growth. M. (U.S. 1958 - Shackelford).

name: The Czar
description: Light Crimson. Large, semidouble. Slow, sturdy growth. M. (For another form of this cultivar see 'Hugh Kennedy'). (Aus. 1913 - N. Breslin, Melbourne).

name: The Czar Variegated
description: Light Crimson blotched White variation of 'The Czar'.

name: The Daffodil
description: Deep Rose. Medium, semidouble resembling a deep cup daffodil. (U.S. 1953 - Fruitland).

name: The Duchess Of Cornwall
description: Pale Silvery Pink. Large, semidouble. Spreading growth. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica 'Adolphe Audusson'). (England 1981 - Carlyon).

name: The Elf
description: Light Pink. Medium to large, semidouble. Slow, compact, dwarf growth. M. (U.S. 1984 - Alfter).

name: The Flirt
description: Blush Pink. Large, semidouble with undulating, notched petals and two or three large petaloids interspersed with White stamens. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1961 - Ragland).

name: The Hobbit
description: Creamy White. Small to medium, single to semidouble. Average, dense, medium growth. E. (N.Z. 2007 - Haydon).

name: The Mikado
description: Rose Pink with narrow, White border. Medium, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica 'Herme'). (Japan to England 1889 - G Waller).

name: The Pilgrim
description: Cream White. Large, full peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1956 - Short).

name: The Real Mccoy
description: White. Large, semidouble with irregular petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - E. McCoy, Fairhope, AL).

name: The Red Baron
description: Deep Red. Medium, rose form double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E. (Hybrid 'J. C. Williams' seedling). (U.S. 1975 - C. R. Phillips, Frederick, MD).

name: The Sam Stallings
description: Cream White. Large, semidouble with stamens intermixed with petals. (U.S. 1961 - S.H. Stallings, Smithfield, NC).

name: The Surrealist
description: Glowing shade of Rose-Red. Large, unknown form. Fast, bushy, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 2015 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Thelma Dale
description: Phlox Pink form of 'Mrs. Baldwin Wood'. Medium, semidouble. (U.S. 1948 - Bradford).

name: Thelma Dale Blush
description: Blush Pink. (Sport of Japonica "Thelma Dale'). (U.S. 1963 - E F Wilkerson, Biloxi, MS).

name: Thelma Sanford
description: See 'Ruth Royer'.

name: Theme Song
description: Red. Medium to large, semidouble with stamen cluster. Slow, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1975 - Novick).

name: Theo De Tullio
description: Light tinted Blush Pink. Large, semidouble with three alternate rows of sweet pea shaped, curved petals and narrower, curved center petals. Average, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1965 - Julington).

name: Theo's Mini
description: Rose Pink. Miniature, anemone form. Average growth. M. (U.S. 1981 - Stone).

name: Theola Clark
description: Rose Red. Large, peony form with White stamens. Vigorous, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1962 - Dr. Parker, Lucedale, MS).

name: Theresa Burnham
description: Dark Red. Medium, formal double. Average, upright, dense growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Marc Eleven' x unknown pollen parent). (U.S. 2013 - Walter Creighton, Semmes, AL).

name: Theresa Marie

name: Thirty Drops

name: Tokiiro-Wabisuke
description: See 'Momoiro-Wabisuke' Camellia Species The genus Camellia is endemic to Southeastern Asia. It is a large genus belonging to the tea family or theaceae. Professor Sealy (1958) comprehensively studied the 81 known species and grouped them into 12 sections. Ming (2000) followed Sealy's system placing the number of species at 199. Professor Chang (1998). worked with more plant material in his investigation. He estimated the number of species to be 280. More recently Gao, Parks and Du (2005) described 198 species in their book, Collected

name: Tsubaki's Bona Bella
description: Rose Pink with White marks on the center of the petals. Medium to large, formal double. Vigorous, upright Q Aa 0 : growth. M-L. (Japonica 'Steve Blount' seedling). (U.S. 2013 - Tsubaki Camellias, Savannah, GA).

"VERMILLION PURPLE GOWN - Reticulata - ('Zhusha Zipao' - Chinese Name). Oriental Red. Very large, loose peony form. M. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China To U.S. 1980 - U. C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

Medium to large, anemone to loose peony form. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Dr. Robert E. Schwartz'). (U.S. Early 1900's - Mary Swords Debaillon, Lafayette, LA).

description: Rose Pink shading to Pink in center. Medium, formal double. Upright growth. M. (Variations of this cultivar include 'Kayel' and 'Wrightii'). (Aus. 1878 - Shepherd).

name: William C. Cromley
description: Light Red. Medium, loose peony form. Average growth. M-L. (U.S. 1991 - J. Aldrich, Brooklet, GA).

name: William C. Noell
description: Delicate Pink shading to Deeper Pink outer petals with White center. Miniature to small, formal double. Average, compact, upright growth. (U.S. 1972 - J. S. Howard, Salemburg, NC).

name: William Carlyon
description: Pink. Medium, single. Spreading growth. (Japonica 'Jupiter' × Hybrid 'Donation'). (England 1972 - Carlyon).

name: William E. Colby
description: Blood Red. Large, semidouble. Bushy, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 1957 - Feathers).

name: William Forrest Bray
description: Dark Red with darker veins and Purple border. Large, formal double. Vigorous, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1966 - Bray).

name: William Forrest Bray Variegated
description: Dark Red blotched White variation of 'William Forrest Bray'. (U.S. 1966 - Bray).

name: William George Beavis
description: Soft Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, compact growth. M. (Aus. 1968 - Mrs. W. G. Beavis, Doncaster, Vic.).

name: William H. Cutter
description: Rose. Medium to large, semidouble with small petaloids in center. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1955 - W. H. Cutter, Macon, GA).

name: William H. Cutter Variegated
description: Rose blotched White variation of 'William H Cutter'.

name: William Hertrich
description: Deep Cherry Red. Very large, semidouble with heavy irregular petals, folded and intermixed with stamens. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (Reticulata 'Cornelian' seedling). (U.S. 1962 - Asper).

name: William Honey
description: White striped Carmine, sporting Carmine. Medium, anemone form with stamens inclined to occur in bunches interspersed with large, upright petaloids. Vigorous, bushy, slightly pendulous growth. M-L. (Aus. 1955 - A. W. Jessep, Melbourne).

name: William Jackson
description: Red with Fuchsia overlays. Large to very large, loose to full peony form or semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1972 - W. B. Jackson, Tyler, TX).

name: William Jackson Pink
description: Dark Pink with Yellow anthers, Large to very Large, loose to full peony form or semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-L. (Sport of Japonica 'William Jackson'). (U.S. 2019 - Tommy Weeks, Conroe, TX).

name: William Khoury
description: Crimson Red with Yellow anthers and Red filaments. Medium, semidouble form. Slow, upright, open growth. 1 minute left in chanter Summer-Winter - Continuous. (Seedling of Non-reticulata hybrid 'Scarlet Glory × C. azalea'). (U.S. 2021 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: William Paulk
description: Red striped White. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1989 - E. Paulk, Ocala, FL).

name: William Paulk Lavender
description: Deep Lavender with Gold anthers and Pink filaments. Medium, semidouble. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'William Paulk'. (U.S. 2007 - Gordy).

name: William Penn
description: ('Bell Camp'; 'Purple Peony'). Dark Purple Red marbled White. Small to medium, full peony form. Vigorous, slender, willowy growth. M. (Not the cultivar listed in old literature). (U.S. 1854 - Ritchie and Dick, Philadelphia, PA).

name: William R. Blanchard
description: Deep Pink to Light Red. Medium, semidouble. (U.S. 1953 - Thomasville, GA).

name: William Rosa
description: Salmon Pink. Medium, semidouble. Compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1954 - Rosa).

name: William S. Hastie
description: See 'Mathotiana'.

name: William S. Hastie (Mississippi)
description: See 'C. M. Hovey'.

name: William Sellers
description: Deep Crimson. Very large, semidouble with very large folding petals. Slow, spreading growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Tali Queen' × Reticulata 'Cornelian'). (U.S. 1976 - W. E. Sellers, Mobile, AL). "WILLOW WAND - Reticulata - ('Liuye Yinhung' - Chinese Name). Light Orchid Pink. Large, rose form double to semidouble with irregular, wavy petals of silky, velvety texture. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1948 - Descanso and Peer).

name: William Spragg
description: Deep Red marbled and flecked White. Large, semidouble. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1975 - Mrs. A. Spragg, Sutherland, NSW).

name: William's Lavender
description: Lavender Pink. Medium, single. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (U.S. 1950 - Fruitland).

name: Williamina Soper
description: Pale Pink striped Deeper Pink. Medium, formal double. M. (Aus. 1980 - Oke's Gdn. Nsy., Bomaderry, NSW).

name: Williams Middleton
description: Dark Red veined lighter Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1941 - Middleton).

name: Williamsii Alba
description: White. Medium, single to semidouble with fluted and twisted petals. Vigorous, compact, bushy growth. E-M. (Hybrid J. C. Williams' seedling). (U.S. 1960 - R. Carr, Tulare, CA).

name: Williamsii Semidouble
description: See 'Citation'.

name: Willie Hite
description: Light Pink shading to Deeper Pink at petal edges. Medium, semidouble with heart-shaped petal edges and crinkled center petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1956 - W. M. Hite, Marion, SC).

name: Willie Moore
description: Red with darker stripes. Large, semidouble. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Tick Tock).

name: Willie Moore Variegated
description: Red and White variation of 'Willie Moore'.

name: Willie's Child
description: Deep Rose Pink. Medium, peony form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1956 - Tick Tock).

name: Willie's Child Variegated
description: Deep Rose Pink blotched White variation of 'Willie's Child'.

name: Willmetta
description: Apple Blossom Pink. Small, single resembling an apple blossom. Slow, open, willowy growth. (U.S. 1950 - Will and Metta. Jensen, Kent, WA.).

name: Wilma Sheffield
description: Dark Cerise Pink. Large, semidouble with upright petals and occasional intermingled stamens and petaloids. Average, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1962 - H. G. Sheffield, Silsbee, TX).

name: Wilmer Stewart
description: Brilliant Pink blotched White. Large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1979 - W. Stewart, Savannah, GA).

name: Win Houlden
description: Dark Rose. Large, peony form. Average, spreading growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Saluenensis). (N.Z. 1982 - Mrs. I. Berg, Whakatane).

name: Wind Song
description: Deep Pink. Large, loose peony form with segments of Golden stamens interspersed among petals. (U.S. 1960 - Camelliana).

name: Windale
description: Bright Red. Large to very large, semidouble with crinkled petals. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Japonica 'Reg Ragland'). (U.S. 1975 - G. Stewart, Sacramento, CA).

name: Winged Victory
description: White. Large, semidouble to peony form. (Aus. 1966 - G. Waterhouse).

name: Wings
description: See 'Herme Pink'.

name: Wings Of Song
description: Clear White. Medium to large, loose peony form with large petaloids. (U.S. 1960 - Shackelford).

name: Winifred Baldwin
description: Pink and White bordered White. Large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1989 - Mrs. D. Baldwin, Charleston, SC).

name: Winifred Hafele
description: Cherry Red with Light Red tipped Light Gold stamens. Large, loose peony form with large, wavy petals and two sets of stamens. Average growth. L. (U.S. 1960 - Julington).

name: Winifred Sebire
description: Deep Rose Pink. Very large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Tali Queen' seedling). (Aus. 1972 - Sebire).

name: Winifred Womack
description: ('Bobby Guillot'). Blush Pink. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, slightly pendulous growth. M. (U.S. 1955 - A. Davis, Coden, AL).

name: Winifred Young
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble. Open, spreading growth. M-L. (N.Z. 1989 - K. Brushfield).

name: Winkie
description: Dark Rose Pink. Large, rose form double with crinkled, upright petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-L. (Similar to "Tomorrow'). (U.S. 1969 - Dunn's Camellia Gdns., Mobile, AL).

name: Winner's Circle
description: Salmon Pink. Very large, semidouble to loose peony form. Vigorous, upright, compact growth. M. (Reticulata seedling). (U.S. 1984 - Nuccio's).

name: Winnie Davis Ii
description: See 'Donckelarii'.

name: Winter Carnival
description: White. Medium, formal double. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1953 - Short).

name: Winter Cheer
description: Crimson with lighter center. Medium, semidouble with irregular petals. Bushy growth. M-L. (Aus. 1945 - A. O. Ellison, Sydney).

name: Winter Gem
description: Cherry Red. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-L. (Hybrid 'Margaret Waterhouse' seedling). (Aus. 1977 - Sebire).

name: Winter Morn
description: White. Large, semidouble to anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1955 - E. W. Miller, Escondido, CA).

name: Winter Rouge
description: Hot Pink. Medium, semidouble with rabbit ears. Vigorous, open, spreading growth. E-M. Fragrant. Cold hardy. (Oleifera x Sasanqua). (U.S. 1997 - T. Dodd Nsy., Semmes, AL).

name: Winter Sun
description: Deep Pink. Large, loose peony form. Vigorous, open, spreading growth. E-M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' seedling). (Aus. 1970 - Tuckfield).

name: Winter Treasure
description: White, sometimes with small dash of Rose-Red. Large, semidouble with slightly wavy, notched petals. Vigorous, slightly pendulous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1952 - Miss R. Loman, Wilmington, NC).

name: Winter's Beauty
description: Shell Pink. Small, peony form. Average, dense, upright growth. E-M. Musky fragrance. Cold hardy to - 15°F. (Japonica 'Billie McCaskill' x Oleifera). (U.S. 1995 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Beauty Chartreuse
description: Pink. Small, semidouble. Average upright, dense growth. E-M. Cold hardy. (Sport of Hybrid 'Winter's Beauty"). (U.S. - Camellia Forest, Chapel Hill, NC).

name: Winter's Charm
description: Lavender Pink. Medium, full peony form. Average, upright growth. E. Cold hardy to - 10°F. (Sasanqua x Oleifera). (U.S. 1987 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Cupid
description: White flushed Pink near apex with large central cluster of Golden anthers. Unknown size, semidouble with curved and fluted petals. L. (Oleifera 'Plain Jane' x Oleifera 'Narumi-gata' × Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira'. (U.S. 2008 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Dancer
description: Dark Pink shading to Light Pink at margins. Unknown size, semidouble to loose peony form. Slow, spreading growth. M. (Sasanqua 'Bill Wylam' × Oleifera 'Plain Jane'). (U.S. - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Darling
description: Deep Cerise Pink. Miniature, anemone form. Average, spreading growth. E. Cold hardy to - 10°F. (Sasanqua 'Shishi- Gashira' x Oleifera). (U.S. 1992 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Dream
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, compact, upright growth. E. Cold hardy. (Sasanqua 'Peach Puff' × Oleifera 'Plain Jane'). (U.S. 1988 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Fancy
description: Deep Pink. Unknown size, semidouble with creped petals. M. (Sasanqua 'Bill Wylam' × Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' x Oleifera 'Plane Jane'). (U.S. 2009 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Fily
description: White. Small to medium, anemone form to formal double. Average, upright growth. E. (Sasanqua 'Mini-No- Yuki' × Oleifera). (U.S. 1990 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Fire
description: Bright Reddish Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E. Cold hardy to -10°F. (Oleifera/Sasanqua x Sasanqua). (U.S. 1992 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Fire Variegated
description: Bright Reddish Pink with White spots and streaks. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E. (Oleifera/ Sasanqua × Sasanqua). (Discovered in 2005 on 'Winter's Fire' US National Arboretum). (U.S. 2013 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Hope
description: White. Medium, semidouble. Average, spreading growth. E. Cold hardy to - 10°F. (Oleifera x Hybrid 'Frost Princess'). (U.S. 1987 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Interlude
description: Pink. Miniature to small, anemone form. Average, dense, upright growth. E. Cold hardy to - 15°F. (Oleifera seedling). (U.S. 1990 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Joy
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble with fluted petals. Average, upright growth. E. Cold hardy to - 10 °F. ({Oleifera 'Narumi-Gata' x Oleifera 'Plain Jane'). (U.S. 1997 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Moonlight
description: White. Unknown size, single to anemone form. Average, compact growth. M-L. Cold hardy to -15°F. (Japonica "Tricolor Red [Siebold].' x. Oleifera 'Plain Jane'). (U.S. 2009 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Own
description: Pink. Large to very large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'LASCA Beauty' x Reticulata hybrid 'Arbutus Gum'). (Aus. 1985 - M. Greentree, Kingsgrove, NSW).

name: Winter's Own Variegated
description: Pale Pink marbled and moired White variation of 'Winter's Own'. (Aus. 1989 - M Greentree, Kingsgrove, NSW).

name: Winter's Peony
description: Light Pink. Small, peony to rose form double. Average, upright, dense growth. E-M. Cold hardy to -5°F. (Oleifera 'Plain Jane' × Oleifera 'Narumi-Gata' x Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira'). (U.S. 1999 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Red Rider
description: Lavender Pink. Miniature to small, single. Very slow, upright, dense growth. E. Cold hardy to -10°F. (Sasanqua 'Shishi- Gashira' x Oleifera 'Lu Shan Snow'). (U.S. 2000 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Rose
description: Shell Pink. Miniature, formal double. Average, spreading growth. E. Cold hardy to - 15°F. (Oleifera 'Plain Jane' x Sasanqua). (U.S. 1988 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Snowman
description: White. Small, semidouble to anemone form. Average, upright growth. E. Cold hardy to -10°F. (Sasanqua Oleifera x Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' × Oleifera 'Plain Jane'). (U.S. 1997 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Star
description: Violet Pink. Large, single. Average, compact, upright growth. E. Cold hardy to - 5°F. (Oleifera 'Lu Shan Snow' x Sasanqua 'Showa- no-Sakae'). (U.S. 1988 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Star Ii
description: Lower growing version of 'Winter's Star'. (U.S. 1997 - Bond Nsy., Dallas, TX).

name: Winter's Star Light
description: White to Blush Pink with some Light Pink flecks. Medium, single. Average, dense, upright growth. E-M. Cold hardy. (Hybrid 'Frost Prince' x Sasanqua). (U.S. 1997 - Bond Nsy., Dallas, TX).

name: Winter's Sunset
description: Lavender Pink. Medium, single. Average, upright growth. E. Cold hardy to -5°F. (Oleifera ' Plain Jane' × Hybrid 'Frost Princess'). (U.S. 1998 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Toughie
description: Lavender Pink. Unknown size, semidouble with fluted petals. Slow to moderate growth, somewhat spreading. M. (Oleifera 'Plain Jane' x Sasanqua 'Jean May'). (U.S. 2009 - Ackerman).

name: Winter's Waterlily
description: White. Small to medium, anemone form to formal double. Average, upright, somewhat spreading growth. E. (Sasanqua 'Mine-no-yuki' x Oleifera). (U.S. Ackerman).

name: Winton
description: Carmine. Small, single. (Cuspidata x Saluenensis). (England 1950 - Williams).

name: Wirlinga Belle
description: Soft Pink. Medium, single. Average, open growth. E-M. (Rosaeflora x Williamsii seedlings). (Aus. 1973 - T. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Bride
description: White. Miniature, single with crepe petals. Vigorous, spreading growth. E-M. (Tsaii × Cuspidata × Fraterna). (Aus. 1992 - T. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Cascade
description: Pink. Miniature, single. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (Hybrid 'Wirlinga Belle' seedling). (Aus. 1987 - T. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Garland
description: Deep Pink. Medium, semidouble.

name: Wirlinga Gem
description: Pale Pink deepening to petal edge. Miniature, single. Spreading, pendulous growth. E. (Hybrid "Tiny Princess' × Roseaflora). (Aus. 1981 - T. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Jewel
description: Pink with lightly veined Deeper Pink petals. Miniature, rose form double to formal double. Average, open growth. E. (Hybrid 'Tiny Princess' seedling). (Aus. 1998 - I. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Plum Blossom
description: Light Pink. Miniature, single. Vigorous, upright, open growth. E-M. (Rosaeflora x Fraterna seedling). (Aus. 1999 - T. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Princess
description: Pale Pink fading White at center with Deeper Pink under petals. Miniature, single to semidouble with crinkled petals. Average, open, spreading growth. M. (Hybrid "Tiny Princess' x Rosaeflora). (Aus. 1977 - I. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Rosette
description: Soft Pink. Miniature, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (Hybrid "Tiny Princess' seedling). (Aus. 1996 - I. J. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Ruffles
description: Light Pink to Pink. Miniature, semidouble; petals ruffled with filament in a center cluster. Vigorous, open growth. E-M. (Hybrid "Tiny Princess' seedling). (Aus. 1998 - T.). Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Wirlinga Snow Drift
description: White with Pink margins on the petals. Medium to large, semidouble.

name: Wishing Star
description: Light Pink. Medium to large, semidouble to anemone form with star-shaped outer petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1958 - McCaskill).

name: Witch Doctor
description: Rose Red. Large, semidouble to rose form double. Average, compact growth. E-M. (U.S. 1960 - G. Demetropolis, Mobile, AL).

name: Witman Yellow
description: White tinged Yellow. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1963 - Homeyer).

name: Wo-He-Lo
description: Rose Pink. Medium, rose form double. Average, upright growth. M. (Saluenensis hybrid). (U.S. 1975 - Kramer).

name: Wobby Boy
description: White, flecked and blotched Light Pink, shading to Darker Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L (U.S. 1983 - W Herbert, Ruston, LA).

name: Wonder Child
description: See 'Betty Sheffield Blush'.

name: Wonder Of White
description: White. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 2002 - Gordon E. Eade, Pensacola, FL).

name: Wonderland
description: Brilliant, Deep Rose. Large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, open growth. M-L. (U.S. 1960 - Short).

name: Wood Sprite
description: Blush Pink. Small, semidouble. Vigorous, bushy, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - McCaskill).

name: Woodford Harrison
description: Deep Rose Red veined Red. Very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/Japonica hybrid). (U.S. 1980 - Pursel).

name: Woodland Glen
description: Rose Red with touch of White on last row of petals. Large, semidouble. Average, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1965 - Novick).

name: Woodland Manor
description: Vibrant Red. Very large, semidouble. Average, upright, spreading growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Royal Velvet'). (U.S. 2016 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Woodland Manor Ruffles
description: Bright Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium to large, semidouble. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (Seedling of Reticulata hybrid 'Frank Houser"). (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Woodland's Pink Pearl
description: Peach Pink shading to a Light Pink center. Medium, formal double with petals pointed and incurved. Average, upright, dense growth. M-L. (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Woodland's Red Beauty
description: Dark Red with Yellow anthers and Light Pink filaments. Large, semidouble. Average, upright, open growth. M- L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Snow Lady'). (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Woodlands Beauty
description: Red. Large, anemone form. Average, bushy growth. E-L. (N.Z. 1975 - Mrs. R. J. Clarke, Auckland).

name: Woodrow Johnson
description: Rose Pink. Large, peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1949 - Katz).

name: Woodville Red
description: ('Mrs. White'; 'Martin Roberts'; 'Kollock'; 'Gruenwald Red'; 'Henri Bry'). Deep Strawberry Red. Large, peony form. Slow, upright growth. M. (For variations of this cultivar see Japonica 'Early Woodville Red Blush' and 'Woodville Red Blush'). (Europe to U.S. 1822 - Woodville, MS).

name: Woodville Red Blush
description: Blush Pink fading to White. (Sport of Japonica 'Woodville Red'). (U.S. 1961 - L G Thomas, Mobile, AL).

name: Woody Estes
description: Light Pink speckled and striped Red. Medium, full peony to anemone form. (Sport of Japonica 'Professor Charles S. Sargent'). (U.S. 1956 - C. Estes, Sea Island, GA).

name: Wrong
description: Deep Rose Pink. Large, anemone form with notched outer petals surrounding petaloids in bunches surrounding wavy petals, stamens and petaloids. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1963 - Ashby).

name: Wrong Variegated
description: Deep Rose Pink blotched White variation of 'Wrong'.

name: Wroughtii
description: See 'Amenonaeflora Alba

name: Wylmer Pool
description: White to Blush with Pink petals, solid Pink and Pink and White. Large, semidouble to peony form to formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1973 - Tammia).

name: Wyn Carter
description: Dark Purplish Red veined Darker Red. Medium, rose form double. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (N.Z. 1991 - T. Lennard, Te Puke).

name: Wyn Hawkes
description: White. Large, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (Aus. 1985 - R. Hawkes, Woodside, S. Aus.).

name: Wynelle Greenway
description: Medium Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, semidouble to rose form double. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (U.S. 2018 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Wynne Rayner
description: Lavender Pink. Medium to large, semidouble to anemone form. Vigorous, open growth. M. (Saluenensis seedling). (N.Z. 1967 - B. J. Rayner, Stratford).

name: Wynyard
description: Pink. Medium, peony form. M. (Aus. 1962 - Wynyard, Tasmania).

name: Wyte Byda Twayla
description: White. Medium to large, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 2019 - Camellia Heaven - John Grimm, Bush, LA).

name: X-Tra Pink
description: Deep to Light Rose Pink, at times with Bluish sheen or Bluish undertones and veining. Large, semidouble to anemone form to peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1998 - P. Gilley, Grand Ridge, FL).

name: Xiafeng Relang
description: See 'Summer's Wind and Hot Waves

name: Xiameng Wenqing
description: See 'Wenging's Summer Dream

name: Xiameng Yulan
description: See 'Yulan's Summer Dream

name: Xiaoguiye
description: See 'Small Osmanthus Leaf.

name: Xiaoye Mudan
description: See 'Small Leaf Peony'.

name: Xiaoyulan
description: See 'Small Magnolia'.

name: Xiguiye
description: See 'Narrow Osmanthus Leaf".

name: Xizi Xianghe
description: See 'Westlake Fragrant Lotus

name: Yae-Arare
description: White edged Pink. Medium to large, single.

name: Yamato-Nishiki
description: White variegated Pink and Red. Medium, single with full flared stamens. Slow, compact growth. M. (For other forms of this cultivar see below and 'Ohkan' and 'Showa-no-Hikari"). See Higo.

name: Yamato-Nishiki Rose
description: Pink. (Sport of Japonica 'Yamato- Nishiki').

name: Yamaya
description: Pink tinted Purple. Medium, single.

name: Yanhong
description: Deep Red to Red (RHS 53A or 53B) with Yellow anthers and Light Yellow filaments. Small, semidouble. Average, dense growth. M. (Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' × Sasanqua Shinonome'). (China 2009 - Jian Guo Fei, Yong-hong Hu and Ya-li Zhang, Shanghai Botanical Garden of Shanghai, China). YULETIDE - Formerly Vernalis - Orange Red. Small, single. Average, upright, dense growth. E. Cold hardy. (Seedling of Sasanqua 'Hiryu'). (U.S. 1963 - Nuccio's). YULETIDE CANDLE - Formerly Vernalis - Brilliant waxy Red. Large, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Sasanqua 'Yuletide' seedling). (U.S. 2014 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL). YULETIDE SPIRIT - Formerly Vernalis - Deep Coral Red. Large, single. Dense, upright, spreading growth. (Sasanqua 'Yuletide' seedling). (U.S. 2000 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Ye Ming Zu
description: See 'Evening Glow Pearl.

name: Yeamans Hall
description: Shell Pink with Darker Pink striping. Medium, formal double. E-L. (U.S. 2006 - Sam Borom. Propagated by Coastal Carolina Camellia Society. Mt. Pleasant, SC).

name: Yellow And Purple
description: ('Yiao Huang Wei Zi' - Chinese Name'; 'Tinges of Yellow and Purple'). Light Pink with Light Purple/Lavender undertones and a small amount of Yellow at the base of the central petals. Medium, formal double with slightly waved petals. Average, open growth. [(Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' × 'Nitidissima hybrid 'Honeymoon') × Japonica Elaine's Betty']. (U.S. 2012 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Yesterday
description: Bright Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis x Japonica "Tomorrow'). (England 1981 - Carlyon).

name: Yiao Huang Wei Zi
description: See 'Yellow and Purple

name: Yifen Mudan
description: See 'Spinel Pink Peony'.

Hybrids With Other Than Reticulata Parentage (Non- Reticulata hybrids) Hybrids with Reticulata parentage previously have been listed in the section entitled 'Species Reticulata and Hybrids with Reticulata Parentage. The following are cultivars of hybrids with parentage other than Reticulata. Many of these hybrids are Saluenensis × Japonica which generally are known as Williamsii Hybrids.

name: Zuiko-Nishiki
description: White splashed Red. Medium, single. See Higo. SPECIES RETICULATA AND HYBRIDS WITH RETICULATA PARENTAGE The predominant opinion is that Reticulata is not a distinct species, but is a hybrid of other species, probably largely Pitardii (which also is believed to be a hybrid) fractionally combined with Japonica. The Yunnan Reticulatas, which were imported into the United States from China in 1948 by Ralph S. Peer of Hollywood, California and Descanso Gardens of La Canada, generally have been listed as Reticulata and their seedlings listed as Reticulata Hybrids. It is the opinion of many that such cultivars represent garden forms of Reticulata, some Pitardii Variety Yunnanica, and some hybrid crosses of both. Many such cultivars are over three hundred years old. Therefore, it is believed advisable to list Reticulatas and Hybrids with Reticulata Parentage in this same section. Cultivars imported directly to the United States from China during the 40's, 50's, 60's and 80's have been marked with an asterisk (*).
